loans.name: Hòa

texts.en:
Hòa is 43 years old and she is married with two children. Hòa lives with in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Mrs. Hòa operates a fishing business. Hòa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2014, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. This is Hòa's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hòa faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor’s latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Hòa hopes that her children will find good jobs, to buy land of her own, and to make enough money to provide for her kids with her business profits.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Hà operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for six years. Hà is 29 years old and she is married with four children. Hà lives with her four dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hà faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

Hà hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria (pictured) is 33 years old and lives in a village about two hours from town. She has three kids who attended school. Maria buys and sells vegetables. She buys vegetables from the market and transports them by her own motor to sell in her local market. When she has free time, she also sells meatballs from home. 

Her husband assists his wife in business and he is also a motorcycle driver when he has free time. Maria is asking for a loan to buy a new set of spare parts for their motorcycle for her husband because some of the parts are breaking down.

loans.use: to buy a new set of spare parts  for her business.

loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
Amancia is a married woman  from Jagna, Bohol, and a mother of four children. Her eldest child is 24 and the youngest is 15. Amancia has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income.

Amancia is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Amancia hopes to make her business a successful one. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El señor Daniel es de Mizque, tuvo una instrucción hasta el nivel primario los bajos recursos económicos de sus padres no le ayudaron a seguir superándose, desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar, pero con el tiempo la falta de trabajo en el lugar donde vivía le obligo a dejar su pueblo para buscar  mejores opciones para salir adelante, fue así que llego al trópico de Cochabamba, empezó a trabajar de peón en las cosecha de arroz, plátano, piña y otros productos de la región, hace 20 años atrás se compró su propio lote agrícola, actualmente tiene 49  años de edad es soltero, vive solo dedicado a sus cultivos, en el lugar en el que se encuentra no cuenta con los servicios básicos necesarios porque es alejado de la población de Ivirgarzama,el mismo cuenta con 19.6205 has  de terreno, donde se dedica al cultivo de piña y arroz, actualmente solicita un crédito para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, de esta forma lograra obtener buenos ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Daniel is from Mizque, and completed primary school education. His parents' lack of economic resources meant that he was unable to continue studying, and he had to work from a young age. However, over time, the scarcity of work in the place where he lived forced him to seek better opportunities to move forwards. This is how he arrived at the tropical town of Cochabamba.

He began working as a labourer harvesting rice, plantain, pineapple and other local produce. 20 years ago he bought his own agricultural plot. Today, he is 49 years old and single, and lives alone making a living with his crops. The place where he lives doesn't have any basic necessary services, because it is a long way away from the town of Ivirgarzama. He has 19.6205 hectares of land, where he works growing pineapple and rice. At the moment, he is requesting a loan to look after his crops, so that he can gain a good income and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to look after his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase security equipment

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan vive en una zona rural de la provincia de Tiraque, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, principalmente se dedica a la agricultura junto con su padre, su situación económica actual no es muy buena, tiene escasos recursos económicos, no tiene una casa propia y vive en la de su padre, es de estado civil soltero sin dependientes económicos, trabaja arduamente en su principal actividad agrícola y pecuaria, para realización de la misma tiene que contratar personal eventual como sus vecinos, para la siembra y cosecha de sus productos agrícolas, para la siembra utiliza sus yuntas  que son sus propias vacas y para la preparación de terreno utiliza su tractor agrícola. Ya que no tiene muchos recursos, actualmente se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para capital de operaciones con el fin de comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza), semilla de papa y ganado vacuno, para aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan lives in a rural area of the Tiraque province. He is very responsible and hard-working, and makes a living in farming with his father. Juan does not have a very good financial situation: he does not have much money and he does not own a house but instead lives in his father's. Juan is single and has no dependents. He works hard in his farming and cattle-raising work. To carry out these activities he has to hire temporary workers from the neighbourhood, to sow and harvest goods. For sowing crops, Juan uses his own cattle, and he has a tractor for preparing the land. As he does not have much money, Juan needs to take out a loan in order to buy organic manure (hen droppings), potato seeds and bovine cattle to increase his income and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic manure (hen droppings), potato seeds and bovine cattle.

loans.name: Maria Merlynda

texts.en: Maria Merlynda is 50 years old, married, and lives with her family. She has a farm, where she grows and sells pigs while her husband works abroad.  Maria Merlynda has six years experience in this field.  She works everyday in order to provide income for the family, and to show her responsibility and love to serve her family. Maria Merlynda requested this loan to buy additional piglets. She wants to develop her business and increase her profits. The couple wants to give their children a better education.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El señor Ronald tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la zona norte de la ciudad, está casado con la señora  Jimena,  cuenta con un grado de instrucción de nivel bachillerato y tiene  2 hijos pequeños dependientes de sus ingresos, demuestra ser una persona responsable y trabajadora. Su principal actividad es el servicio como ayudante de carnicería en una empresa reconocida a nivel nacional, con una antigüedad de 11 años en el rubro. El solo saca adelante a su familia por esa razón tiene otra actividad de fin de semana y se dedica al servicio de construcción para así generar dinero extra. La razón por la que solicita el crédito es porque necesita pagar la refacción de su vivienda, que se encuentra en mal estado debido a las continuas lluvias que afectaron a muchas personas durante estos últimos meses, si no realiza la refacción el techo puede caer y ocasionar accidentes, por ello es de gran importancia, de esa forma lograra mejorar las condiciones en las que vive su familia actualmente.
texts.en:
Ronald is 37 years old and lives in the north of Cochabamba; he is married to Jimena. Ronald completed high school and has two young children who depend on his income. Ronald has shown himself to be responsible and hard-working. Ronald's main job is as a butcher's assistant at a business that is known across the country. He has been working there for eleven years, Ronald is only able to help his family to get ahead, however, with another job at the weekend - he works as a builder to earn a little more money.

Ronald is applying for this loan as he needs to pay for his home to be refurbished. It is currently in a bad state due to the constant rains which have affected many people over the past few months. If Ronald does not carry out repairs to the roof, it may fall and cause accidents and, as a result, it is very important that he improve his family's current living conditions.

loans.use: to fix his roof before it collapses

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca runs a funeral parlor and also has a junk shop to earn additional income. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used for her operating expenses. Rebecca’s earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Rebecca is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to pay for the operating expenses of her funeral parlor and to buy supplies and materials needed. She will use the profit from her loan to sustain her daily needs. Rebecca looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She dreams of making it big in business and she hopes that her future will be secured. Rebecca meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the operating expenses of her funeral parlor and to buy supplies and materials needed.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
This is Ferdinand, 35, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Daisy, a supervisor, and they have children. He and his wife manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Ferdinand operates an LPG business. What he basically does is buy Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers, and resells them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of LPG tanks to expand his product inventory.

Ferdinand dreams to expand his business and hopes to give his children a good life and education. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partner /clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stocks of LPG tanks to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 61 years old and married with five children. 

Teodora is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Teodora requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teodora has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her rice farming  business.

Teodora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business, Luzviminda requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Luzviminda has been in this business for ten years now. With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job lives in Kisii with his wife and three children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has been doing farming for the past six years. His primary income source is from milk, eggs, tea and his retail business.He states that his biggest challenge is the low prices of milk, which bring a low return.

Job chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they give small-scale farmers dairy loans for more milk production. During the training, he learned how to manage his loans. This loan will increase his milk production for sale and for his family's consumption. The more milk he produces, the more income he will get. This will improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: For purchasing a dairy cow

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
This is Mwanasiti. She greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. 

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more bundles of clothes for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of clothes for her business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce operates a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of kids’ wear clothes for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids' wear clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en:
Mwero is a married woman with one child. She lives at her own house that has no electricity and piped water.

She has operated a food vending business for the past three years, cooking chapati (flat bread), rice and beans. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of KES 30,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business.

loans.name: Bubatma

texts.ru: Бубатме 50 лет, разведена. Имеет троих детей, старший сын самостоятельный, работает и живет отдельно. У Бубатмы среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей, как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Бубатма в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи уже 20 лет занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур и откормом коров, также торговлей продуктами питания, начав этот бизнес с 80,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бубатмы, она смогла развить и расширить свой бизнес, ее деятельность приносит стабильно около 20,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Бубатме расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубатма обратилась в  Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку коров, а также на оставшиеся средства купит оптовые товары для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Бубатма планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет построить сарай для скота.
texts.en: Bubatma is 50 years old and divorced. She has three children; her oldest son is self-sufficient and works and lives separately. Bubatma has a secondary education. Her neighbors have a good opinion of her as a kind and hardworking woman. For the main source of income for her family, Bubatma has been growing crops, fattening up cows for the past 20 years, as well as selling food products. She started this business with initial start-up capital in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Bubatma's hard work, she has been able to develop and expand her business. This business brings in a steady income of about 20,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves to cover the food expenses and everyday needs of her family.  For the purpose of further developing her business, Bubatma turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows as well as to buy wholesale merchandise with the rest of the money for subsequent retail sale. Bubatma plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase her business. She also wants to build a cattle barn in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows and wholesale merchandise for retail sale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a garage business, giving services to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the KES 70,000, she wants to purchase car batteries for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase car batteries for her business.

loans.name: Emilya

texts.en:
Emilya is from Vernashen village, where she lives with her husband and two sons. Her second son is an army officer and the eldest son helps his parents run a farm.  The farm that Emilya and her family run includes livestock including two cows, two calves and 18 chickens.  In addition to agribusiness, Emilya also teaches at the local village school.  

The reason Emliya has applied for this loan of $2,350 is to enrich her farm with two oxen and to hire workers for organizing cultivation work.  As this is Emilya's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF.  This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and to hire workers for organizing cultivation work.

location.town: Vernashen village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Dzhenishkul

texts.ru: Дженишкул 41 год, замужем, имеет троих детей. Дженишкул имеет средне-специальное образование. Ее характеризуют как ответственного, целеустремленного, и доброжелательного человека. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие.Дженишкул в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 40,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Дженишкул в хозяйстве имеет: 2 дойная корова, 2 бычка и 20 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,14 Га, на которой выращивает фасоль. Ее сельхоздеятельность приносит около 10,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дженишкул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Дженишкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет женить старшего сына и построить ему дом.
texts.en: Dzhenishkul is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Dzhenishkul has a secondary-specialized education. She is characterized as a responsible, motivated and considerate person. Her husband and children help her with her business. Her family is very close-knit; they have good relationships with each other. As an additional source of income for her family, Dzhenishkul practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business in 2000 with 40,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Dzhenishkul's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 2 bull calves and 20 sheep and 1 horse on her farm. She also has a 1.14 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans. Her agricultural business brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves to cover the family's food expenses and everyday needs. For the purpose of further developing her business, Dzhenishkul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows. Dzhenishkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further expand her business. She also wants to marry of her oldest son and build him a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Doris Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Doris es originaria de la ciudad de León. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de carpintería tiene 14 años de experiencia en el negocio con sus ahorros ha logrado ampliar su inventario de madera y satisfacer la demanda de su clientela. Su principal meta es que su negocio siga creciendo. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Madera, Lija entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mejores ingresos y así logrará superarse poco a poco en la vida.
texts.en: Doña Doris is from the city of León. She is a merchant by trade; she works in the carpentry business and has 14 years of experience. With her savings she has managed to expand her inventory of wood to meet the demand of her customers. Her main goal is to keep her business growing. She is requesting this loan to buy wood and sandpaper, among other things. She thinks that the loan will be very helpful because she will be able to increase her income and thus gradually improve her life.

loans.use: to buy inventory including wood and sandpaper

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more nails, locks, hinges, door catches, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another 50 bags of charcoal to expand her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, rice, oil, eggs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, oil, charcoal, and other spices for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bread for this business.

loans.name: Nancy Rocio

texts.es:
Nancy Rocío es una señora de 42 años, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos, sus hijos estudian y su esposo se dedica al servicio de taxi. Viven en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, conocida como el puente que une a la sierra y a la costa, un sector muy comercial.
Nancy actualmente trabaja como educadora de niños del MIES, ella visita cada de uno de sus hogares y les da estimulación, este trabajo lo realiza por las tardes. Nancy ahora tiene la oportunidad de ponerse su propio negocio, quiere emprender en un taller de costura ya que además de educadora tiene experiencia en esta rama, ella se graduó de costurera. Nancy necesita comprarse tres máquinas de coser para trabajar realizando uniformes escolares; es por ello que acudió a Fundación Alternativa ya que por referencias del sector le comunicaron que ayudan a gente trabajadora y con un sueño de iniciar un negocio. Nancy fue beneficiada con el crédito, se siente muy agradecida con la institución y el proyecto Kiva por darle la mano y por poder hacer su sueño realidad, está muy feliz y entusiasmada por empezar a coser sus primeras prendas, con esto ella podrá crecer profesionalmente y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy Rocío is 42 years old and lives with her wife and two children. Nancy's children are in school while her husband is a taxi driver. The family lives in the city of Santo Domingo, known as a the bridge between the coast and the highlands, and is a very commercial area.

Nancy currently works in the afternoons teaching children. She visits each of them at their home and tries to stimulate learning. Nancy now has the opportunity to start her own business: she wants to open a sewing workshop as she also has experience in same area, having trained as a dressmaker.  Nancy needs to buy three sewing machines in order to make school uniforms and it is for this reason that she came to "Fundación Alternativa". She has heard in the community that the foundation helps hard-working people who dream of starting a business.

Nancy has been given a loan and she feels very grateful to "Fundación Alternativa" and to Kiva for giving her a helping hand to make her dream a reality. Nancy is very happy and enthusiastic to start sewing her first items. With this she will be able to grow professionally and help her family to prosper.

loans.use: to start up her own sewing workshop and to buy three sewing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cartons of fish for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, fish and other spices for her business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina de 33 años de edad, estudió bachillerato, ella está casada  y su esposo se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, es decir a la siembra de maíz , frijol , maicillo. y hortalizas, tienen tres hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian y sus 3 hijos son los únicos que dependen de ella.

Rosalina se dedica al comercio de productos de la canasta básica, tiene 4 años de ser comerciante y aprendió por iniciativa propia, cuando su esposo estaba en USA le envió dinero para comprar sus primeros productos, luego el negocio fue creciendo hasta hoy en día lo mantiene y sabe administrarlo. 

  El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar tres quintales de azúcar, dos quintales de frijoles un  quintal de sal, 8 fardos de sodas, 5 cajas de jugos y medicina, con ello estará mejorando su negocio ya que lo tendrá más diversificado. 

Su sueño es ampliar cada día mas su negocio, también pretende mejorar su vivienda pues pretende construirle una habitación más para que sus hijos vivan más cómodos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Rosalina is 33 years old; she studied up to high school. She is married and her husband cultivates basic grains like corn, beans, sorghum and vegetables. They have 3 children of which only 2 are in school and their children are her only dependents.

Rosalina sells staple goods. She has 4 years of being a merchant and she learned this through her own initiative, when her husband was in the USA he sent her money to buy her first products. Later on the business kept on growing up to today she maintains it and knows how to run it. 

She is requesting the loan to buy 3 quintales of sugar, 2 quintales of beans, a quintal of salt, 8 packages of soft drinks, 5 boxes of juice and medicine. With this she will able to improve her business since she will have more diversity. 

Her dream is to expand her business every day. She also plans to improve her house; she would like to build a room so that her children live more comfortably in the future.

loans.use: to buy 3 quintales of sugar, 2 quintales of beans, a quintal of salt, 8 packages of soft drinks, 5 boxes of juice and medicine.

loans.name: Rusdiana

texts.en:
Rusdiana runs a small stall where she sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Rusdiana is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Rusdiana began working with Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. For the last month, she has had around $20 – $21 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Ren Sous' Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Ren is aged 51 years and married with three children, two of whom are still in school. The main sources of the family’s income are from farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 20 years, she is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family needs.

Ren’s group consists of two members and she has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Ren will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Santos Sixto

texts.es:
Santos tiene 39 años de edad, estudió solo segundo grado en la escuela del cantón, está soltero por el momento y no tiene hijos, con él viven sus padres  y sus tres hermanos, nadie mas depende de él .

Él se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como frijol maíz, maicillo, tiene alrededor de 25 años de ser agricultor, aprendió este oficio porque desde pequeño lo llevaban sus padres porque no tenían otra actividad productiva, ahora agradece a su padres que le enseñaron y hoy lo hace por sí solo, él no tiene otra actividad productiva más que la agricultura, siempre ha sido jornalero, el lugar donde trabaja le queda a 25 minutos de su casa y para llegar lo hace caminando, en el trabajo se involucra sus hermanos para hacer mayor cantidad de siembras y para que su actividad sea mas rentable.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar el fertilizante que ocupará en sus cultivos, pues ahora están más baratos, comprará machetes, pagará el alquiler de la tierra donde trabaja y también pagara mano de obra que limpia el terreno.

Su sueño es reforestar una fuente de agua que tiene su madre, en seguida tener su ganado vacuno y que haya producción para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, también pretende limpiar una parte del terreno que tienen para sembrar hortalizas.
texts.en:
Santos is 39 years old and only studied up to Grade 2 in the local school. He is single, has no children and lives with his parents and 3 siblings. No one is dependent on him. He grows basic grains like corn and beans. He has been a farmer for 25 years. His parents taught him to do this when he was young as he had no other productive activity. Today he is thankful to his parents as he does this work for himself. He has no other work than in agriculture. He has always worked as day labor. The place where he works is 25 minutes from his house and he gets there by walking. He works with his brothers to get the maximum quantity of plants and make their work more profitable.

Santos needs a loan to buy fertilizer for his crops as it is cheaper now. He will also buy machetes, pay the rent on the land he farms and pay for labor to prepare the land. His dreams are to re-forest a water source that his mother owns, buy a cow to provide for the household needs and he also hopes to clear part of the land that he has to plant vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and machetes, pay the rent on the land and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for the grocery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing material

loans.name: Sixto Fernando

texts.en:
Macias Dry Cleaners is a family-operated business that was created on 01/10/2013.  Mr. Macias has already contributed around $50,000 for equipment and supplies.  The business is located in a busy area on Topanga Canyon, Chatsworth. It is a family-oriented business; Mr. Macias, Ms. Macias and his wife. 

Mr. Macias believes that hard works pays off.  He has over 30 years of experience in the Dry Cleaning business. He started as an ordinary employee then became a manager and after several years, knew it was time to open his own business.   

Ms. Macias is a big help with the start up of the new business. She has worked in the alterations and tailoring business for many years.  Additionally their daughter, helps them during weekends.

The business is doing very well. Mr. & Ms. Macias are putting their hardworking experience in acquiring new customers by providing good quality washing and cleaning as well as delivery. They have around 30-40 costumers and approximately 150- 200 pieces a day. Mr. Macias uses his skills to impress new clients by providing discount prices, and delivering and picking up clothes.

The Macias family needs funding from Kiva to buy a new Dry Cleaner Machine, which will use all natural dry cleaning fluid, not chemicals. It will be an  environmentally friendly way to keep clients’ clothes clean. Buying a new Dry Cleaner Machine will empower the Macias family to make contracts with Hotels.

loans.use: to purchase a new Dry Cleaner Machine

loans.name: Marash

texts.en:
Marash is a married father of three, ages 19, 16 and 14. He recently purchased the tractor shown in the photograph; he did not have money at that moment, though, to pay for it. Thus, the loan he is requesting will help him pay what he owes on the tractor, and with the rest he wants to buy corn seeds and prepare the land for planting.  

Marash has four dairy cows and two baby calves, four pigs and eight piglets. He sells baby animals to locals and raw milk to a dairy factory in his region. Not only is there a well-known dairy factory in the region that produces high quality cheese, butter and yogurt, but also there are many small sized dairy farms that produce the same high quality dairy products. In comparison with other communes in Albania, almost every household here raises about 100-200 turkeys.

loans.use: to pay for the tractor he recently bought, for which he still owes the money.

loans.name: Classic Kiarutara Group

texts.en:
Classic Kirutara group is a young group of women and men operating small-scale businesses in open air markets in Central Kenya. They travel around different markets with different household items, clothes, shoes and farm inputs. Their target market is households with low income that have to shop in open air markets where items are cheaper. The group that comprises 18 members has been saving with VEP for the last  two years and has developed a very credible reputation with discipline. They have a vision of opening up a distribution stall where they can employ other youths to assist in sales around the local markets which open different days of the week. With this in mind, they would also like to add solar lamps to their stock as one of the products that can help those at the bottom of the pyramid without access to electricity.
Esther,the group treasurer (pictured at the far right) was the first one to buy a solar lamp from VEP during a roadshow to their region. After experiencing the changes in her fuel budget and the quality of light, she promoted the lamp to a friend in the market who agreed to form a group and get the lamps on credit for their homes.Esther says since she bought the lamp, she has saved a lot of money previously used to buy kerosene and for mobile charging. Her children also started enjoying longer study hour which has led to improved grades. Esther and the group would like to see other families enjoy clean, convenient lighting while at the same time making money from the sale of those lamps
They have purchased different types of solar lamps from VEP on credit and with their sale, are confident the group will repay the loan from the profits and even take a second loan to expand the business

loans.use: To purchase solar laterns for sale

loans.name: Siphiwe

texts.en:
32-year-old Siphiwe is a mother of one and lives with her family in the Binga District of Zimbabwe where she has been successfully operating a flea market for the past year. She started the business when she realized that the only way to escape her poor background was to take charge of her life. She is really happy with how far she has come despite people’s criticism. When she is not working at her flea market, Siphiwe serves as a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network for school graduates. As a Cama member, Siphiwe assists vulnerable children in her community by completing home visits. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Siphiwe will make bulk purchases of hats, bags, hair relaxers and women’s clothes. With additional profits, she hopes to expand into a large clothing business and create employment in her community and provide for her child and family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Zymrije

texts.en:
Zymrije is a married mother of four children, living with her family in the southern part of Kosovo. Although she is employed as a cleaner and her husband works in construction and their combined income is still very low, they are a very happy family and always grateful for what they have and receive. 

In the past, they had a cow and they used the milk for family consumption and they sold some additional milk for a small income. They were forced to sell the cow in order to meet the family's expenses, but they would really like to be able to purchase a new one and begin producing milk and milk products, once again. 

Zymrije is requesting a loan for EUR 300 (euros) in order to purchase the cow and she hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand her farm and add even more cows. 

Her goal is to offer her children a better future and life with a better education that she can pay for. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Datévi Délali

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 29ans, Datévi est mariée à une couturière et mère d'01 enfant de 03ans. Il est mécanicien auto et revend des pièces détachées dans une boutique. Pour son quatrième crédit, il espère acheter des pièces détachées auto pour revendre. Le profit lui permettra d'augmenter du stock et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille. Il a une ancienneté de 05ans.
texts.en: 29 years of age, Datévi is married to a seamstress and [has] one 3-year old child. He is an auto mechanic and also sells spare   parts in his shop. For his fourth loan, he hopes to buy spare parts for resale. The revenue will allow him to increase his stock and ensure the well-being of his family. He has been our client for five years.

loans.use: to buy a used car and some spare parts.

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.ru: Мавчигул замужняя женщина, проживающая в районе Хамадони с мужем и четырьмя сыновьями. Ее муж мастер-строитель. Сама Мавчигул домохозяйка. Она собирается начать свое дело. Мавчигул интересуется купле-продажей тканей и хочет открыть бизнес в этом направлении. На сумму своего сбережения она уже приобрела точку продажи, однако для приобретения товара ей не хватает немного средств. Мавчигул в связи с этим обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить партию тканей и начать торговлю. Кредит поможет открыть бизнес и стать независимой женщиной.
texts.en: Mavjigul is a married woman who lives in the Hamadoni District with her husband and four sons. Her husband is a construction foreman. Mavjigul is a homemaker. She is planning to start her own business. Mavjigul is interested in buying and selling fabrics and wants to start a business in that sphere.  With her personal savings, she has already purchased a selling stall. However, she does not have enough money to buy merchandise. In connection with this, Mavjigul requested a loan to buy a shipment of fabrics and start her business. The loan will help her open her business and become an independent woman.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to start her retail business.

loans.name: Sonja

texts.en:
Sonja wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan which has helped her to buy agricultural machinery. The tools and machinery that were purchased have been used to plow the land of their neighbors for a fee. This has helped to improve their living conditions. 

She and her husband are still involved in the same business, and they were very satisfied with the first Kiva loan. Sonja is now requesting a second loan in the amount of 1,500 EUR to purchase new additional tools for their tractor. The loan will again help her to work more effectively and efficiently and be able to again increase their income. 

Sonja is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the financial support given to help her family

loans.use: to purchase new additional tools for the tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blouses and slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Mehmed

texts.en:
Borrower Mehmed is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for the previous support. He used the loan to renovate his toilet and contribute to a better living environment for his family. He continues to work very hard to improve his family’s standard of living and to provide a better life. 

As part of that process, he would like to repair a wall in the house which is very damaged from the rain. The water causes mold and other bacteria to grow. 

Mehmed is now asking for a second loan in order to complete the repairs and to continue to make progress in ensuring good health and living conditions.

He is happy to have this opportunity and appreciates the microfinance help.

loans.use: to repair a wall in the house

loans.name: Tashbubu

texts.ru: Ташбубу 58 лет, замужем, есть дети. Семья Ташбубу во всем помогает ей по хозяйству, а именно в развитии полеводства и животноводства.  Ташбубу стартовав более 20 лет назад с 10,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день имеет ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве содержит: 1 дойную корову и 10 овец. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ташбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом на закупку удобрений и подготовку земли к полевым работам. Доходы от кредита Ташбубу планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота, а также на покупку автомобиля для своего сына.
texts.en: Tashbubu is 58 years old, married, and has children. Tashbubu's family helps with her business, specifically with the development of her crop farming and livestock breeding business. Tashbubu started this business more than 20 years ago with 10,000 som (KGS). She currently has a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  She also has 1 milk cow and 40 sheep on her farm. For the purpose of further developing her business, Tashbubu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to cultivate the soil for field work. Tashbubu plans to use the earnings from the loan increase the size of her herd. She also intends to buy a car for her son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine lives in Lernavan village with her husband, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. Her son is a migrant worker in a neighboring country. 

She runs a small store near the house where they live. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. The requested loan of 3,000 USD will be a huge support for this hardworking woman so she can purchase food supplies for her store. She will be able to meet the current customer demands.

Heghine has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her retail business is successful, and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Heghine has been approved for this loan.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products

loans.use: to pay for food supplies for her store

loans.name: Lifa

texts.en:
Lifa is single, 26 years old, and a very hardworking woman who has spent much time trying to improve her living conditions and standards. 

Lifa originally came from a village where her parents still live and moved to the city with her brother and sister for a better life. As part of this goal, Lifa is a hairdresser and owns a salon. She has many female customers as she charges a low price for her service in order to earn a better profit. She also offers body treatments and services. 

As she has done this for many years, she is now in need of new equipment and some renovations including the repair of the water system. If she can get this addressed now, she will be ready for the upcoming wedding and celebration season which is her busiest time of year. 

Lifa estimates that these improvements will cost her 500 EUR and is confident that the loan will improve her business even more. She hopes that in the future she will be able to further expand her business and to improve her services. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and to renovate

loans.name: Fatmir

texts.en:
Fatmir is the married father of a teenage son.  He has two cows and some goats.  He wants to add some more goats with the money he is requesting from lenders. 

In addition to selling animals and planting a high quantity of potatoes and beans, he produces dairy products and sells them to the local market of his nearby city of Elbasan.  Fatmir is also a reeve, or local administrative agent, in his village and works with road maintenance.

People in his village speak very highly of him and his family and, as per their saying, he is always there for families in the village.

loans.use: to purchase some goats.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José tiene 24 años de edad, su principal actividad es la producción de leche cruda para lo cual cuenta con 5 cabezas de ganado vacuno lechero, hace poco logro comprar más ganado y así aumento su producción, vive en la zona sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es una persona responsable, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superarse, trabajo desde muy pequeño ya que sus padres no tenian muchos recursos economicos y aprendió el valor del sacrificio, el motivo del presente crédito es para comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado lechero dado que por las constantes lluvias este alimento está escaseando y cada vez es más difícil de conseguir, sin este alimento el ganado disminuirá su producción lo cual sería malo, ya que no podrá tener los ingresos necesarios para poder satisfacer sus necesidades y ayudar a su mamá en los pagos de algunos servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Señor José is 24 years old, and his main business activity is the production of raw milk, for which he has 5 dairy cows. He has recently managed to buy more livestock and in this way boost his output. He lives in the south of the city of Cochabamba. He is a responsible, hard-working individual with real motivation to get ahead. He worked from a young age, because his parents didn't have a lot of money and he learned the value of sacrifice. 

The reason he is requesting this loan is to buy animal feed for his dairy cows, given that due to the constant rains this feed is becoming scarce and it is harder and harder to get hold of. Without this feed, the livestock will decrease their production which would be bad, as he wouldn't earn what he needed to meet his needs and help his mother to pay some basic services.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Suparman

texts.en:
Suparman lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Suparman is married and lives with five persons in the family home. In the picture, Suparman is with his wife.

Suparman joined Ruma one month ago because he found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Suparman sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he earned an average of $3 - 4 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Ikatu Group

texts.es:
El grupo de mujeres llamado Ikatu lleva ese nombre debido a que se consideran mujeres capaces de desarrollar nuevos desafíos  y poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido.
La señora María se dedica a manicura y pedicuro, y por medio de su trabajo lucha por salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo. Con el préstamo que pide quiere adquirir nuevos productos como esmaltes, limas, alicates, etc., para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar su ingreso para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Ikatu" women's group is called so as the women are capable of facing new challenges and of being able to help their families by working together.

María makes a living offering manicures and pedicure. Through her work she is fighting to prosper and help her loved ones. This loan will be used to buy new products, including nail varnishes, nail clippers, nail files in order to satisfy her customers' demands and to improve her income so as to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy nail varnishes, clippers, nail files and other goods.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza, the mother of a 14-and 11-year-old wants to invest in an irrigation system. Due to the heavy rain on the day of the interview, it was almost impossible for her to be photographed on her land, so she choose to have the photo taken on the veranda of her family house. The activity that she has been practicing for a long time now has been arboriculture, in particular, apple orchards.
 
Eliza and her family live in a field area. Her village has a very cold climate during the winter and very hot in the summer. The village is known for the beautiful scenery and for the cleanliness of the streets built with cobblestones. In the center of the village a cinema has been built. Residents of this village plant quantities of wheat, potatoes, beans, tomatoes, onions and red peppers. Pears, plums and apples are some of the orchards that households grow the most.

loans.use: to buy an irrigation system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando tiene una tornería en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, es una persona muy luchadora y por sobre todo emprendedora, el cuenta que su préstamo anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda para poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
El pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar varillas de hierro para seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo, agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Armando has a lathe metal workshop in which he works every day from very early in the morning. He is a real fighter, and above all an entrepreneur. He says that his previous loan was very useful and allowed him to continue meeting his client's orders.

He is requesting this loan to invest in buying iron bars so that he can continue working as he has been. He is grateful for this new opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy iron bars.

loans.name: Rwayda Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Rwayda Al- Hodeidah and is composed of four women living in Hodeidah, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB. The president of the group is Akram. She is 42 years old, married, and has six children. She works as a dressmaker in her area. She started her business three years ago by sewing clothes for the people in her area. Over time, Akram earned a good amount of money and she decided to continue in that business. She will use the loan to buy a sewing machine, stylish fabric, and other materials and in this way, will increase her working capital and improve her business. Her reason for applying for this loan is the lack of capital. She faces challenges in her business, including the need to increase her client base, and she will use the profits to improve the quality of life for her family. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB.

Akram looks forward to providing her family with better living conditions. She hopes to buy more sewing machines and open other branches in the city.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, sugar, etc., for her business

loans.name: Phakamile

texts.en:
Phakamile is a 27-year-old lady running a flea market stall where she sells men’s and women’s clothes. She lives with her mother in Umzingwane district in Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running this business for two years and her mother assists her. Phakamile volunteers as a Learner Guide at a local secondary school in her community.

With the requested Kiva loan Phakamile plans to make bulk purchases of the clothes so as to increase sales and profits. With the additional profits, Phakamile intends to expand into layers production and start selling eggs also.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Ahmet

texts.en:
Ahmet is 55 and has four teenage children who help their parents with the agricultural activity, according to him. He wants to buy some sheep of a good breed and he needs your financial help.
 
Ahmet lives near the city of Elbasan and owns some agricultural land where he plants mostly green leafy veggies. In addition to this, he has cows and the dairy products he makes out of their milk he sells at the local market in this city. His cows produce about 18 kg of milk/day according to him. Hence, he covers his family's dairy needs and sells the rest. This is the only income for his family and he wants to increase it by adding sheep. Due to the fact that sheep milk is very fattening, most of it is made into hard cheeses with some of them being made with herbs. In Albania, this cheese with or without herbs is called ‘kackavall’.

loans.use: to buy a good breed of sheep

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divino Niño Jesus está en su ciclo número 18 del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Valeria es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que lucha por salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Valeria vende prendas variadas, y comenta que se hizo ya de muy buena clientela.
Pide este préstamo para comprar jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The "Divino Niño Jesús" group is in its eighteenth cycle with the committee program, where they all work together and help each other out to get ahead. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey. With their hard work and efforts and the implementation of necessary behaviors, they are improving their poverty situation. 

Valeria is the president of this group. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who fights to get ahead and improve her living conditions. Valeria sells assorted clothing and reports that she has already developed a good clientele. 

She is requesting this loan to buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants and other items. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving to continue working.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Guapas Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres integran este grupo llamado mujeres grupas, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se han unido con la consigna de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
La señora Mayra es una de ellas, quien se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas, y comenta que el préstamo que pide es para la compra de prendas varias para poder venderlos, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
Todas las integrantes agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo y luchar por su familia.
texts.en: Seventeen women make up this group called "Mujeres Grupas".  They are women who are heads of their families, who have united under the motto to help one another through working together.  Mayra is one of the members and works in clothing retail.  She states that the loan she is requesting will be used to purchase various clothing items to sell.  This way, she will be able to continue working as she has been doing.  All of the members are grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving to continue growing and fighting for their families.

loans.use: purchase an assortment of clothing to sell.

loans.name: La Fuerza 2 Group

texts.en:
Tania is a woman who lives with her three children in a poverty-stricken community called Los Guaricanos, on the outskirts of the national capital. She has made a small business for herself, selling jewelry from her house and occasionally along the streets in her community. She is asking for this loan to expand her inventory—specifically, she would like to buy a bigger quantity of jewelry and different materials like gold, silver, stainless, etc. With a better variety she can begin to attract new customers, to resell to retailers and consequently increase her income.

Her goal is to become a wholesaler and expand her business to a new and more profitable level. She says she will use her extra income to reinvest and to provide for her family and give them a more comfortable life than she has had.

Tania says she knows that with God’s help and this loan (her 13th), her business will surely grow much stronger. She is very thankful to all of you out there who are helping her by supporting her in this loan!

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Shupikai

texts.en:
Shupikai is a 30-year-old business woman from Muzarabani district of Zimbabwe. She is a Community health trainer working with students to spread health information. She believes information can help change the well being of her community. Shupikai is currently operating a poultry business which she established in 2009 and has successfully grown it to its current capacity. She started the business when she realized that she needed a stable source of income and poultry was a lucrative business to establish at that time. 
 
The Kiva loan will assist her in purchasing chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. Improving her business will bring increased profits which she will use to cater for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds.

loans.name: Sicelile

texts.en:
Sicelile is a 25-year-old single lady who specializes in selling kapenta, soya mince, sugar beans and dried vegetables. She has been successfully running this business for two years and her mother assists her in her business. She lives in Umzingwane district in Zimbabwe. Sicelile also volunteers as a Learner Guide at a nearby secondary school in her community teaching students life skills.  

With the requested Kiva loan, Sicelile plans to expand her business and open a shop in the resettlement area where she stays so that she could enjoy more profits. Sicelile intends to plough the additional profits back into her community by assisting vulnerable families.

loans.use: to open a shop.

loans.name: Sibusisiwe

texts.en:
Sibusisiwe is a single woman, age 28, who lives in Umzingwane district, Zimbabwe with her parents. She has been running her business, selling chickens for four months. Her mother assists her since she cannot afford to employ anyone else in the business. 

When she is not attending her business, Sibusisiwe serves as a Learner Guide at a local secondary school in her community, teaching students life and study skills and volunteering to clean schools. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Sibusisiwe plans to expand her business and make bulk purchases of chicks and feed to increase sales volume and profits. With the additional profits, Sibusisiwe intends to further her studies, go for a tertiary education, and also financially assist her family.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Nocebo

texts.en:
Nocebo is a 26-year-old business lady running a flea market where she sells a variety of clothes and shoes. She lives in Umzingwane district with her husband and one child and she has been successfully running her business for three years and her family members assist her in the business. When she is not attending her business, Nocebo serves as a Learner Guide at a local school and in her community teaching students life skills.  

With the requested loan, Nocebo plans to make bulk purchases of clothes, shoes, sandals and blankets. This would make her enjoy more profits and high sales. With additional profits Nocebo intends to pay her fees for tertiary education.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothes, footwear and blankets

loans.name: Rudorwashe

texts.en:
Rudorwashe is a single woman who is 25 years old from Gokwe North District, Zimbabwe. She operates a grocery shop from the local business center. This business has been running for the past two years. She sells sugar, flour, rice, soap, cooking oil, biscuit, toothpaste, baked beans, sweets and mealie-meal. 

With the requested Kiva loan she would like to make bulk purchases of sugar, flour, rice, soap, cooking oil, biscuit and mealie-meal. This will enable the expansion that she had always dreamed of. In five years time she foresees her business being vibrant and employing other members of the community. To give back to her community, Rudorwashe volunteers at her local school as a community health advocate and a Learner Guide where she teaches students life skills education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 23 years old and single. She lives in Umzingwane, Zimbabwe. Vivian has been successfully running a flea market where she sells women's and men’s clothes for two years. Her mother assists her in her business. She also volunteers as a Learner Guide at a local secondary school in her community teaching students life skills. 

Vivian requested a loan, which she will use to make bulk purchases of clothes and shoes so that her sales volumes and profits may increase. With the additional profits, she intends to pay rent and her agricultural college fees.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Nomathemba

texts.en:
Nomathemba is a 24-year-old lady doing buying and selling of new and second hand clothes .She has been running her business for 3 years. Nomathemba is still single and she stays with her siblings and grandparents in Umzingwane district in Zimbabwe. When she is not working at her business, Nomathemba volunteers as a peer educator in her community and surrounding schools. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Nomathemba plans to make bulk purchases of second hand and new clothes as they are in demand. This will assist her to make the purchases at lower costs and she will, thus, enjoy more profits. With the additional profits she intends expand her business and create employment for her community members. She also plans to go for tertiary education at a teachers' college and pay her fees using the profits.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of second hand and new clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks.

loans.name: La Fuente De Bendicion 6 Group

texts.en:
Hirza is a member of La Fuente de Bendicion 6 (The Source of Blessing). They are five micro-entrepreneurs in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. Hirza is the mother of five children, and they live together with her long-term partner in a rural village outside the town. She started selling clothes almost 11 years ago. 

Hirza is receiving her 11th loan. She repaid her previous loans on time and made good investments. She is planning to use her new loan to purchase miscellaneous products to resell, like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc. She started her business with a loan she received from Esperanza almost 10 years ago. After she had taken her first three loans from us, she stopped taking loans from Esperanza for approximately three years, but now she has started again. Since this second chance, she has taken 11 other loans. 

Hirza will use the profits to continue rebuilding her house. Little by little, she plans to finish building it. Her most important challenge is to continue improving her business. She is really focused on helping her children to get a better education, good health and a better life. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics and other products to sell

loans.name: Estrellas Brillantes 3 Group

texts.en:
Ysabel is the coordinator of Las Estrellas Brillantes (Shining Stars) Group 3, which consists of 5 micro-entrepreneurs from Samana. This city is a tourist city located in the northeastern part of the country. She is the mother of three children. 

Ysabel lives with them and her long-term partner. She is selling shoes for women, men and kids. She started her business almost 10 years ago with her own savings. Now she is requesting her 16th loan. She will use this loan to buy different styles of shoes, like tennis shoes, sandals and others. Previous loans have improved her business.

Ysabel wants to save her profits to reinvest into her business, and to finish building her house with a better structure than the one she currently has. Ysabel and her group thank you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
Koeju se llama este grupo que trabaja unido y gracias a la ayuda mutua de todas ellas están saliendo adelante. Son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que no pudieron tener.
La señora Alicia es integrante del comité es casada y comenta que trabaja en un comercial como empleada y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, para que de esa forma pueda reforzar sus ingresos por medio de este trabajo.
Ella lucha por poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en: The name of this group is Koeju.  They work together, and thanks to their mutual support they are getting ahead.  They are female heads of households that want to give their loved ones everything that they were not able to have.  Alicia is a member of the group.  She is married and states that she works as as an employee for a business.  She is seeking this loan to purchase clothing so that she can supplement her income through this line of work.  She fights to continue improving her living conditions and provide her loved ones with everything that she was not able to have.

loans.use: purchase an assortment of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jehova Jireh Group

texts.en:
Consuelo is a single mother. She lives in her home built with a simple structure, like others in her community, with two of her three children in the city of La Romana in one of the rural areas that are called bateys. Most bateys are located in a sugarcane field, and were built for the sugarcane industry workers. 

Consuelo says one of her most favorite things to do are to take her children to eat ice cream and to the park. And her most important challenge is to continue growing in her life and business. Since four years ago, Consuelo started her clothing sales business with the money she received when she stopped working in a company. 

Consuelo is receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully paid back her previous loans and will invest this capital in her clothing sales business; this loan will be invested to buy new clothing (pants, shirt, skirts and other pieces). With her business profits, she will reinvest in her business. She dreams of having a nail and beauty salon in a better location. Consuelo and her group are going to devote themselves to various areas of work such as clothes, cosmetics, shoes, beauty salons, grocery stores, etc. 

Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
El lleva por nombre Divino Niño  está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
La Sra. Debora entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que  tiene venta de Lencerías ya que a través de su esfuerzo que está haciendo es para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy luchadora que con esfuerzo y sacrificio está mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de lencería para poder seguir trabajando y mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir luchando.
texts.en:
This group is called Divino Niño  and is in cycle number 7 of the program of the women's committee. All of the women work and support one another to succeed. 

Among the work that Debora does is selling lingerie. Through her hard work with this she supports her family. She is a fighter, who with effort and sacrifice is improving her living conditions. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying lingerie so that she can continue working and improving living conditions for her family. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving to continue fighting.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes, jackets and handbags.

loans.name: Sandile

texts.en:
Sandile is a 19-year-old single lady running a poultry business in Umzingwane district in Zimbabwe. She has been into this business for six months and her sister assists her. Sandile also serves as a Learner Guide at a local secondary school in her community teaching students valuable life and study skills. 

With the requested Kiva loan Sandile plans to make bulk purchases of chicks and feed which will lead to increased sales and profits. With the additional profits Sandile intends to expand her business and create employment.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 27-year-old woman running a flea market in Umzingwane district in Zimbabwe. She sells women’s clothes and shoes at the flea market. Judith is a single mother of one child. She has been successfully running her business for five years and is very proud of what she has accomplished so far. She employs one person who assists her in her business. Judith also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools teaching study and life skills. She also is a behavior change facilitator in her community. 

With the requested Kiva loan Judith plans to make bulk purchases of the clothes and shoes so that the sales volumes and profits may increase. With the additional profits Judith intends to open a shop in her home area and create even more employment. This would also assist in paying fees for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes, bags and towels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en:
Tendai is a 24-year-old businesswoman. She is married with a son and lives in the Nyaminyami district of Zimbabwe. She is currently operating a successful poultry project which she has been doing for over a year. She is being assisted by husband. There is a high demand for chickens in her community and she is taking that as an opportunity to make a profit. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Tendai intends to expand her project into a viable supplier of white meat in the community. She even hopes to create employment in the community and also provide a better quality life for her child. When she is not working in her business, she serves her community voluntarily by disseminating health information and cleaning the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds.

loans.name: Mujeres Divinias Y Encantadoras Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades comerciales variadas, cada una de ellas hace su mejor esfuerzo por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
La señora Celina es integrante del comité de mujeres es soltera y vive en su casa con su madre e hijos, ella trabaja como corredora de quiniela desde hace varios años, y pide este préstamo para poder comenzar en el servicio de mini cargas en su casa y también la venta de productos Avon, esto le permitirá obtener un ingreso más para su hogar.
Agradece esta oportunidad de poder seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en: The 17 members of this group work in different commercial activities.  They all make their best effort to improve their living conditions and those of their families.  Celina is a member of this group of women.  She is single and lives with her mother and children.  For many years she has worked as a betting broker, and she is seeking this loan to start selling prepaid cellphone minutes from her home as well as Avon products.  This will allow her to earn an extra income for her household.  She is grateful for this opportunity to continue growing and fighting.

loans.use: pay for prepaid cellphone minutes and purchase Avon products.

loans.name: Letwin

texts.en:
Letwin is a 27-year-old business woman. She is married with two children and currently lives in the Gokwe North district of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school where she teaches students valuable life skills. 

To support herself, Letwin has been successfully operating a grocery shop for one year and has managed to employ one person. She sells margarine, drinks, sugar, cooking oil and flour. With the requested loan she intends to buy cartons of sugar, drinks, cooking oil, rice, flour and margarine. Letwin wishes to expand her business to a bigger and more reliable source of income in the next five years. 

The Kiva loan will help her improve her business thus upgrade her standard of living and to take care of her two children.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Progress

texts.en:
Progress is a 24-year-old business lady who is also single and lives in the rural district of Gokwe North in Zimbabwe. She volunteers at her former school to clean the school yards and counsel students. She has been operating a grocery shop for one year and seven months. 

With the Kiva loan she will make bulk purchases of flour, cooking oil and washing powder so as to boost her business and make more profits. In the near future she hopes to expand into a large retail business and also improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a 19-year-old lady from Umguza District. She has her own business where she sells a variety of products such as hair chemicals, jewelry and other make-up accessories. She started two years ago as a way to be financially independent. Currently, Linet lives with her parents and siblings and volunteers as a Learner Guide at a nearest secondary school in her community teaching students life skills.  

With the Kiva loan, Linet will expand her business by purchasing more of these and increase the sales volumes and profits. With the profits, she wants to assist her family and the needy. She also hopes to create employment for her community.

loans.use: To purchase more hair chemicals, jewelry and other make-up accessories.

loans.name: Kareen

texts.en:
Kareen is a 26-year-old business lady who runs a vegetable market. She has been success fully running this business for six years and employs one person to assist her in the business. Kareen is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Umzingwane district of Zimbabwe. Kareen is also a Learner Guide in her community volunteering in schools to teach students life lessons. 

With the requested Kiva loan Kareen plans to expand her business and make bulk purchases of seed, manure and fertilizers so that she can produce more to sell and get more profits. With the additional profits Kareen intends to select needy girls and assist them with fees payment and also improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of seed, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Zorodzai

texts.en:
Zorodzai is a 33-year-old business woman. She is a single mother of one boy. To support herself she has been successfully operating a stall at the flea market for over a year selling clothes. Zorodzai started the business when she separated from her husband and needed a way to support herself. She started the business small, selling clothes door-to-door. She is very proud that the business has grown and she now has enough money to rent a stall at the local market. She is being assisted by her family members to run the business. 

With the requested loan she intends to make bulk purchases of clothes in order to reduce costs and maximize profits. With the profits she hopes to create employment in her community and also improve her standard of living. When Zorodzai is not working at the flea market she is volunteering as a Community Health Trainer in the community and in schools.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goats and vaccines.

loans.name: Sitshengisiwe

texts.en: Sitshengisiwe is a business lady who is 32 years old and a mother of one child. She lives in the Umguza district of Zimbabwe, where she runs a business rearing chickens. Her business is only six months old, but is going very successfully so far. She also volunteers in her community by nursing those who are bedridden. Sitshengisiwe has applied for the loan to boost her business to a big poultry project. She wants to give back to the community by using the profits from her business to assist needy and vulnerable children. The business will also help her earn a living and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
El Sr. Milciades proviene de una familia humilde que se dedica a la confección de artesanías y  su posterior comercialización.
El Sr. Milciades ofrece sus productos casa por casa en diferentes ciudades del país, lleva sobre sus hombros  para que se pueda visualizar el producto. Lleva más de 20 años realizando dicha labor ya que es la actividad con la cual puede mantener a su familia.
