Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de colchas, hamacas, etc., y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Milciades comes from a humble family that is dedicated to making and selling handicrafts.  Milciades sells his products from house to house in different cities around the country.  He carries them on his shoulders so that his products can be seen.  He has been doing this work for over 20 years, with which he provides for his family.  He is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of blankets, hammocks, etc. so that he can continue working as he has been doing.

loans.use: purchase blankets, hammocks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, leche entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; Claudia es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere sentirse ganadora y para lograr el éxito sus mayores secretos son la constancia y la dedicación, esta dispuesta a hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, golosinas, bebidas etc. Claudia tiene la confianza que con su dedicación podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia, age 40, lives in her own house with her two children.  She has a store where she sells basic needs products like rice, beans, and milk, among others.  She has gotten a lot of customers lately.  She always has what people need, her products are excellent quality, the prices are truly affordable, and she provides unparalleled service.

Claudia is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She wants to feel like a winner.  Her greatest secrets for achieving success are consistency and dedication.

She is ready to make her business grow.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy basic grains, instant products, sausages, candy, and drinks, etc.

Claudia is confident that with her dedication she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, sausages, candy, and drinks, etc.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамире 32 года, замужем,есть сын. Вся семья помогает по хозяйству. У Дамиры среднее образование, она уже имеет достаточный опыт работы в сельскохозяйственном секторе, так как последние четыре года занимается откормом скота и торговлей продуктами питания.  Для начала бизнеса у нее было всего 30,000 сомов (KGS), за четыре года она приобрела контейнер, где сейчас и занимается реализацией. Прибыль от ведения хозяйства и занятия торговлей приносит Дамире ежемесячную прибыль в размере 17,000 сомов (KGS). В Банк "Бай Тушум" Дамира обращается уже в третий раз, она очень ответственна и исполнительна. На полученные деньги Дамира планирует купить коров и отправить их на джайлоо для откорма, в дальнейшем Дамира хочет купить еще один контейнер, что позволит ей расширить свой бизнес и увеличить прибыль от реализации.
texts.en: Damira is 32 years old, married, and has a son. The entire family helps her on the farm. Damira has receives secondary education. She has sufficient experience in the agricultural sector since she has been fattening livestock for resale and selling food products. Her staring capital was 30,000 KGS. In four years she has been able to save up for a sales booth where she sells her merchandise.  Damira’s monthly income from her farm and retail activities is 17,000 KGS. This is the third time Damira is applying to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution. She is very conscientious and disciplined. Damira plans to use her loan to buy cows and send them out to pasture for fattening. In the future she plans to buy an additional sales booth, which will allow her to expand her business and increase her income from sales.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 33-year-old lady from the remote area of Gokwe North, Zimbabwe. She is married and has four children and three other dependants. Judith saw a business opportunity to supply groceries in her community and decided to open a grocery shop to take on the demand that was already present. The business has been running for almost two years now. She sells sugar, drinks, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing and bathing soap, milk powder and margarine. She needs a Kiva loan to expand her business, send her two children to school and be able to care for her other dependants. Her business currently needs capital to boost her purchases and if she gets the loan, she will make bulk purchases of sugar, drinks, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing and bathing soap, milk powder and margarine. Judith is also a part-time student and the profits from the business will enable her to pay for her school fees. When she is not at her business, she serves as a Cama District Chairperson and the Vice-Chairperson of the Cama Zimbabwe National committee. Cama is Camfed’s alumnae network of women leaders and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stock in bulk

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. She is currently operating a shop selling cooking oil, flour, rice, sugar, toothpaste, snacks and drinks. She started the business to supplement her family’s income. With the requested Kiva loan, Stella will expand her business by stocking up on items to sell and using the profits to expand and become a large retail shop owner. She hopes to give back to the community with the profits she makes. To give back to her community, Stella disseminated health information in her community as a community health trainer and a Learner Guide at the local school and in the community.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado kuña rory está en su ciclo número 13 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo arduo que cada una viene haciendo pueden conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariela, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas variadas que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia y darles todo lo que no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, pollo, jamón y demás productos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir haciendo las comidas para poder venderlos.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Rory is in its thirteenth cycle of the program of the women’s committee where they are conducting a survey for the elimination of poverty, and thanks to the arduous work that each one is doing, you can learn about each one’s situation.

One of the members is Mariela, who works selling a variety of foods that she herself makes and later goes out to sell on foot. She is a woman who sacrifices much and fights to bring her family out ahead and give them everything that she was not able to have.

She requests this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of meat, condiments, chicken, ham, and other products so that she is able to continue making these foods to be able to sell.

loans.use: to purchase meat, condiments, chicken, ham, and other products.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable,  dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia.
Ella comenta que aspira ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas, es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, ya que por medio de este trabajo puede servir.
Comenta que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder cumplir su meta. Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jessica is a hard-working and very responsible person, who is dedicated to her studies and her family. She says that she aspires to be a successful professional and hopes to continue studying and help people, which is why she is studying to become a nurse, as this is a way to help others.

She also says that she is putting all her efforts into achieving her goal. She is requesting this loan to invest in paying her university fees and continue studying like she has been.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Omega

texts.en: Omega is a 22-year-old business lady. She is currently single and lives in the Gokwe North District of Zimbabwe where she has been successfully operating a grocery shop for five months. To give back to her community, she volunteers at her local school as a Learner Guide disseminating life skills and health education to students. With the requested Kiva loan, Omega hopes to make bulk purchases of biscuits, tea leaves, flour and sugar to make large profits. With the additional profits, she hopes to donate fees to vulnerable children and provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stock in bulk

loans.name: Anastencia

texts.en: Anastencia is a 19-year-old business lady. She is single and lives in the Gokwe North district in Zimbabwe. She is very passionate about keeping children in school so she donates uniforms to vulnerable girls in school. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school where she teaches students life skills education. She also volunteers to clean local secondary schools so that students can have a good learning environment. To support herself, Anastencia has been successfully operating a poultry project for two years. She produces and sells broilers to the local community members and butcheries. With the loan, she intends to make purchases of chicks, stock feed and even expand the fowl run. She hopes to use the profits to pay her school fees and be able to create employment in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Thobekile

texts.en: Thobekile is a 26-year-old young busines woman who lives in the Umguza district of Zimbabwe. She is a married woman with three children. Currently, she is selling chickens in her community and is using part of the little profit to support her family. Thobekile also works with Mother Support Groups in her community together with other CAMA members to assist vulnerable children in their areas of need. She intends to use the Kiva loan to boost her business by purchasing more chicks and enjoying larger volume sales and profits. If the business grows bigger, she hopes to create employment in her community and use part of the profits to support her family and help the needy in the community.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 19-year-old young woman from Umguza District, Zimbabwe. She serves as a Camfed Learner Guide in local schools, teaching students life skills. She is currently running a business buying and selling sweets and snacks. She has been successfully running this business for eight months now.

With the Kiva loan she is requesting, she intends to expand her business and buy more supplies. This will help her family and those who are needy since she helps the vulnerable people of her community whenever she can. She would also employ other people to assist her in the business so as to participate towards the development of her community.

loans.use: to buy more supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Junior

texts.en: Junior is a young business lady who lives in Umguza, Zimbabwe and is 18 years old. She is currently running a business buying and selling new clothes like skirts, tops, jeans and trousers. She started the business recently after attending Camfed’s Learner Guides training and now her business is five months old. The Learner Guide program places recent secondary school graduates in local schools to help students gain valuable life and study skills. Junior also works with Mother Support Groups in her community in assisting vulnerable households with food and also assisting them in their fields. She is planning to use her Kiva loan to purchase more clothes to increase the supply to her customers in the community. With the profits that she will get from her business she is planning to supplement her ordinary level and to help her family and the needy in the community.

loans.use: To purchase more skirts, tops, jeans and trousers.

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en: Tendai is 29 years old and is a Cama member from Gokwe North district in Zimbabwe. She is a motivated single lady and entrepreneur who has been operating a flea market for the past six months. This business is the main source of income for her family. She sells assorted women’s clothing including jean skirts, t-shirts, dresses and formal skirts. Tendai chose to do this business as she saw that there is high demand for her clothes in the area as there are few suppliers. She would like to expand her business when she gets this Kiva loan by buying large quantities of skirts, blouses, shoes and blankets. The loan will help her to buy more clothing to sell and also to provide for her family. Tendai wants to develop her business to be a more viable boutique that sells quality clothes all year round. When she is not at the flea market she will be at the local clinic helping voluntarily to clean. She is also a life skills facilitator at local schools.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Naume

texts.en: Naume is a 26-year-old businesswoman. She married with one child and lives in Nyaminyami district, Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a shop for the past year and is being assisted by her family members. Naume started this business as a hobby and later discovered that she can earn a living from it. With the requested loan, she plans to make bulk purchases of sugar, soap, soft drinks, bread, shoe polish, rice and other groceries in order to reduce costs and boost her sales to make large volumes of profits. She hopes to improve her standard of living and also give back to the community. She is a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school where she teaches students life skills. Naume also follows up on students who have dropped out in order to ensure that they come back to school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia está cursando el último año en su carrera de Derecho, ella está sobresaliendo sola en su estudio,  por medio de su sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Ya que sus padres no tienen ingreso seguro, ella está luchando por poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su profesión. Ella hace lo posible para ayudar a sus padres con el trabajo que está teniendo ya que trabaja en dos lugares. Su objetivo al terminar sus estudios es tener su propio estudio jurídico y llegar a tener un buen ingreso económico para llegar a ayudar a sus padres y llegar a independizarse.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que este es su último año y quiere poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Sonia is in her final year of her law degree. She is excelling on her own in her studies, through her sacrifice and hard work.

Since her parents do not have a stable income, she is fighting to support her family through her profession. She is doing everything she can to help her parents with her two jobs. Her aim is to complete her studies and establish her own law firm so that she earns a good salary to help her parents and achieve independence.

She is requesting this loan to invest in her graduation fees, as this is her final year and she wants to be able to pay for this expense.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation fees.

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en: Colleta is a 19-year-old single business woman who lives in the rural district of Gokwe North, Zimbabwe. For her business, she buys and sells clothing in the local market. She has been doing this for one year and has been very successful. During this year, she has managed to employ one person to assist her in running the business when she is not there. She sells dresses, skirts, blouses, shorts and briefs. With the Kiva loan she intends to purchase boys' shorts, girls' skirts, pants and wraps. With the additional profits she hopes to expand into importing clothes from other countries. When she is not at the market she volunteers as a peer educator at her local school. Colleta really wants to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Spiwe

texts.en: Spiwe is a 38-year-old businesswoman living in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe with her husband and two daughters. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for over four years selling mealie meal, cooking oil, rice, flour, sugar, snacks, soap, body cream and salt. Spiwe knows that there is demand for the items that she sells and as her village is very remote, her shop is the closest thing to a town where people in her community do their grocery shopping. She is also a very active community member who helps others by teaching business skills. She also helps in the cleaning up of the girls’ hostel at the local secondary school. When she is not working in her shop Spiwe serves as a Community Health Trainer. With this loan, Spiwe intends to make bulk purchases of mealie meal, cooking oil, rice, flour, sugar, snacks, soap, body cream and salt to reduce transport costs and boost her sales in order to earn more profits. She hopes to create employment and give back to the community.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth viene de una familia integrada por 3 personas, ella optó por la Carrera de Farmacia porque es algo que le gusta, ya que le agrada compartir con las personas.
Su aspiración es la de llegar a recibirse de Bioquímica para culminar todos los demás anhelos que tiene en mente, para darle a su familia un mejor vivir.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que así podrá cubrir este gasto y seguir luchando por cumplir con su meta.
texts.en: Ruth comes from a family of three, and chose to do a degree in pharmaceutical studies, because it is something she likes, because she enjoys sharing with others. She aspires to graduate in biochemistry so that she can achieve all of the other dreams she has in mind, so that she can give her family a better quality of life. She is requesting this loan to invest it in her graduation fees, because in this way she will be able to pay for this expense and continue to fight to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation fees.

loans.name: Priviledge

texts.en: Privilege is a 21-year-old lady who is single and a mother of one child living in Umguza District. She is doing a poultry project in order to support herself. She has been in this business for one and half years now. Privilege is also a Learner Guide at a nearby secondary school in her community where she teaches students valuable life and study skills. She intends to increase the production of her chickens with the requested Kiva loan so that she can benefit from high sales volumes and profits. With the profits that she will be getting from the business she will be able to pay fees for her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 25-year-old businesswoman. She is a married mother of one and she lives in the Nyaminyami district of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully buying and selling clothes and is being assisted by her family members. She started the business to provide for her family. She wanted to raise school fees for herself and her sisters. Charity sells pants, blankets and assorted shoes. 

With the requested loan she intends to make bulk purchases of clothes and become a viable supplier of clothes in her community. When Charity is not working at the flea market, she is doing volunteer work including cleaning the school yard, the clinic and sometimes community parks.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita comenta que su meta es llegar a obtener su título y ejercer mi profesión de Ingeniera Agrónoma, ya que esa es la carrera que está estudiando.
Ella a  pesar de muchos obstáculos, de una lucha constante esta por alcanzar ese sueño. Su motivación es estudiar esa carrera universitaria con el fin de ayudar más a su familia ya que es la única que llegó a culminar el bachiller.
Pide este préstamo para el pago de su tesis, ya que necesita poder cubrir ese gasto y de esa forma estar más cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Margarita states that her goal is to obtain her certificate and work on her profession as an Agronomist, since this is the career she is studying. Despite all the obstacles and a constant struggle, she is almost ready to reach this dream. Her motivation is to study a college career in order to help her family more considering she is the only one who was able to graduate from high school. She is requesting this loan to pay for her dissertation because she needs to be able to cover this expense and in this way be closer to her goal.

loans.use: To pay expenses for dissertation.

loans.name: San Francisco De Asis 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yefer is the coordinator of his group, San Francisco de Asis 1 & 2 Group. This group is located in a rural area of Santiago. He makes his home there in a simple structure, with his long-term partner and one of his two children. He says his dream is to have his own house and a big tailoring business. 

Yefer is excited to be taking his fifth loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic, after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He has had his business for almost four years, starting with the money he received after he quickly completed a job. 

Yefer plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying different fabrics, threads, and accessories. He will also use future profits to reinvest in his business, to produce clothes, bed clothes, and many other products. He thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, and accessories needed in his tailoring business.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es: Sonia de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ellos trabajan y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar, ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo y dedicación el negocio es muy reconocido en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Para Sonia es muy importante mantener activo este negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda tales como: huevos, golosinas, azúcar, arroz, leche, frijoles, pan dulce, gas propano y de más artículos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño de seguir mantenido activo su negocio y por consecuencia seguir trabajando por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Sonia is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. They work and help her with the household expenses. She is known for being an honest, hard-working and above all enterprising woman. 

Several years ago, she managed to set up a small shop in her home and thanks to God and her hard work and dedication the business is very well known in the area, which is why she has a large customer base. 

For Sonia, is is very important to keep this business going because it is her main source of income. This is why she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying merchandise for the shop such as eggs, sweets, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread, propane gas and other items which may attract customers. In this way, she hopes to achieve her dream of keeping her business open and consequently, continue working towards a better future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sweets, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread, propane gas and other items.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica se considera una chica humilde, sencilla y bastante sacrificada. Es una persona que lucha bastante por poder lograr sus metas. 
Ella está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y comenta que su sueño es poder tener algún día su propio estudio contable.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, ya que así podrá cubrir ese gasto y seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Monica considers herself a humble, straightforward, and selfless young woman. She is a person who fights to achieve her goals. She is studying for an accounting career and her dream is to one day have her own firm. She is requesting this loan to cover her college fees and continue studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and other expenses.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas vive con sus padres y hermanos, actualmente sigue la carrera de contabilidad, específicamente en su tercer año, a la vez está trabajando en una serigrafía hace dos años.
Su meta es trabajar en una entidad financiera, ya que está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y quiere poder usar todo ese conocimiento para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y luchando por cumplir su meta.
texts.en: Blas lives with his parents and siblings. He is currently studying accounting and is in his third year. At the same time, he has been working at a screen printing company for 2 years. His goal is to work at a financial institution since he is studying accounting. He wants to be able to use this knowledge to help others. He is requesting a loan to pay for tuition fees so that he can continue studying and striving to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан 31 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают троих детей. Вся семья с большим удовольствием помогает по хозяйству. У Токтокан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Токтокан занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Токтокан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Токтокан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку удобрений и подготовку почвы к весенне-полевым работам. Доходы от кредита Токтокан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, нарастить активы и планирует накопить средства для постройки дома.
texts.en: Toktokan is 31 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Her whole family helps out with the household with pleasure. Toktokan has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Toktokan practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 7 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Toktokan's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow, 1 horse and 10 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Toktokan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to till the land for the spring sowing season. Toktokan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock and build up her assets. She also intends to save money to build a house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years now. 

Aileen requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she  would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase car spare parts and renovate his workplace

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 36 years old and married.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has been running this roofing business for 3 years,and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Analiza requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.   She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy nipa palm fronds

loans.name: Pensando En El Futuro 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Basilia is one of the members of Grupo Pensando en el Futuro (Thinking about the Future), located in the city of Samana. This group is composed of twenty micro-entrepreneurs who sell clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and fruits, and who also provide services including a beauty salon. 

Basilia is a businesswoman who lives with her three children and with her long term partner.  She tells us that her greatest challenge is helping her children to grow and become professionals. She is very excited to receive her ninth loan with Kiva partner Esperanza Internacional, which she will invest in her business inventory by buying gasoline, motor oil, and other types of fuel, to resell from her house, located in one of the main routes in Samana. Basilia  has had her business for about 6 years. She started it with some savings she had. Her dream is to have a successful business and a comfortable house.

loans.use: to buy fuel to resell

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
To earn a living, Charlita owns a farmland, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community. With her generated income from the farm, her previous loan was successfully repaid. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDPMC) in the year 2011 and it has been her partner in her business activities. 

Now, Charlita has requested a loan to purchase feed in order to improve her pigs. She hopes for more income, to use for her family's better future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is 68 years old and married.  She works hard to support her family.  Carlita has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  

Carlita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc for her food vending business.

Carlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables like squash, eggplant, etc. to sell in her vegetable vending business.  Celina has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns more income from selling root crops.

Celina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Zhumabu

texts.ru: Жумабу вдова, одна воспитывает сына, который всегда с радостью помогает матери по хозяйству. У Жумабу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством. Стартовав пару лет назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сомов (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Жумабу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 30 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 150,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумабу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум". Она планирует закупить овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Жумабу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на обучение сына.
texts.en: Zhumabu is a widow and raised her son alone. He always helps his mother around the house with pleasure. Zhumabu has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding. She started this business a few years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zhumabu's hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows and 30 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 150,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Zhumabu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She plans to buy sheep to fatten up and then sell at the market for a high price. Zhumabu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also is determined to save money for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Clara has a business selling ready-to-wear products in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years.  

Clara requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like shirts, skirts, shorts, etc. to sell.

In the future, Clara would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fish selling business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Emelia has been in this business for 10 years now.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es de la ciudad de San Pedro, el es un joven que está luchando por salir adelante y por medio de sus estudios poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
El está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería agrónoma, ya que quiere poder ser un profesional útil para la sociedad.
Fernando pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando, y luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Fernando is from the city of San Pedro.  He is a young man who is fighting to get ahead.  Through his studies he will be able to help his family and his loved ones.  He is studying agricultural engineering, so that he can become a professional with useful skills for society.

He is seeking this loan so that he can invest in his education and pay his tuition fees.  This will enable him to keep studying and to keep fighting to reach his goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Andronica

texts.en:
Andronica is from the village of Bayabas, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur.  Fifty-four-year-old Andronica is married and has 4 children. She has been planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale for a living. She also raises pigs for sale and earns additional income from it. 

In 2007, Andronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and it has helped improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  With her generated income from her farm, Andronica successfully repaid her previous loans used for farming.  Recently, she took a new loan to buy feed for her pigs. She wants to have a better living in the future with her family.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Ma. Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 41 years old and married.  She has five children who are all in school.  Minda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  

Minda requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, sardines, etc. to sell.  

Minda has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 14 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.  She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and married, and she works very hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 7 years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lolita works hard to support her family.  She has a coffee shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Lolita is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like milk, coffee, sugar for her coffee shop for her coffee shop business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy coffee shop food supplies

loans.name: Yoern's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Moung Russey district where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Yoern is a 46-year-old mother of two children. Rice farming and working for others for a fee are the main sources of her family’s income, which she and her husband have been doing for 12 years. The current business earns her about 40,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need.

This is the 9th microloans for Yoern with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a new loan.  Yoern will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and a portion to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Ma. Morita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Morita works hard to support her family.  She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling seafood. 

Morita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to  purchase additional stocks like shorts, shirts, etc. to sell in her ready-to-wear products business.

Morita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear products in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 7 years, and also earns more income from selling nipa roofing.

Merlie is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like shirts, slippers, shorts, etc. to sell in her ready-to-wear business.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

Merlie dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Xandra

texts.en:
Xandra is 28 years old and has two children, one of whom in school.  Xandra works very hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sugar, coffee, spices, etc. to sell.

Xandra has been in this business for 5 years.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 46 years old and married, with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Alma has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rong's Group

texts.en:
Rong is 56 years old and married.  She is a citizen from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living  She has struggled to feed her 7 children by farming rice on two-hectare farmland. 

Rong just joined VisionFund for this cycle and is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Rong will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Aged 61 years old, Horn is a widowed mother of six children living in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, Horn has been farming rice for 12 years.  She is able to earn about 30,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Horn has been with VisionFund for five cycles, and she completely repaid her past loans.  These loans have enabled her to better support her family.  Now leading her group of four to apply for a new loan, Horn wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.  With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Yoern's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Moung Russey district, Yoern is 56 years old and married.  She has nine children, one is still in school. She is a rice farmer who has been growing rice for several years and she can earn about 45,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Yoern has been with VisionFund for five cycles and had completely paid back her past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan.  She is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make their living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ma. Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 44 years old and married with two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

Josie runs a pre-paid mobile loading business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more loads to sell.

Josie has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her pre-paid mobile load business for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Josie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy mobile phone reloads

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice grains selling business in the Philippines.

Ofelia requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Ofelia has been in this business for 4 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy rice to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old and married, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, like spices, soap, and shampoo.

Ana has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from direct-selling and farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like spices, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy is 50 years old and married. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she has seven children, three of whom are still in school. 

To make a living, Sophy has been farming rice and growing cassava for 15 years. She is able to earn about KHR 140,000 per day, but she can manage to save about KHR 60,000 each day, after daily expenses. 

Sophy has been a client with VisionFund Cambodia for five cycles. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, Sophy wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income, to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Kaliypa

texts.ru: Калийпа вдова, воспитывает несовершеннолетнюю дочь, которая всегда активно помогает матери по хозяйству. У Калийпы среднее образование, на сегодняшний день она занимается откормом скота и полеводством. Вложив первоначально 30,000 сомов (KGS) в свой бизнес, она увеличила количество скота до 4 овец и 1 коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сомов (KGS). Скот в зимний период содержится дома, а летом выводится на джайлоо. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калийпа обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум". Она планирует купить корову. Доходы от кредита Калийпа хочет вложить в постройку сарая для содержания скота зимой. А также собрать средства на обучение дочери в университете.
texts.en: Kaliypa is a widow and is raising a young daughter, who actively helps her mother around the house. Kaliypa has a secondary education. She currently fattens up cattle and practices crop farming. Investing an initial 30,000 som (KGS) in her business, she increased her herd to include 4 sheep and 1 cow. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). In the winter, her livestock are located on her farm; in the summer, they will be brought out to pasture. For the purpose of further developing her business, Kaliypa turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She plans to buy a cow. Kaliypa plans to invest the earnings from the loan in building a barn to house the livestock in the winter. She also intends to save money for her daughter's university education.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de Diciembre está en su ciclo número cuatro del programa de comité, todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, están haciendo la encuesta como un medio de poder trabajar para mejorar su situación de pobreza.
Nadia es parte del grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora. Ella es auxiliar contable, y también en sus tiempos libres hace la venta de zapatillas bordadas.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de zapatillas y canutillos para seguir haciendo sus zapatillas bordadas, y así seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The 8 de Diciembre group is in its fourth cycle with the committee program.  All of them are in the eliminating poverty program.  They are completing the survey as a means to be able to work together to improve their poverty situation.

Nadia is part of the group.  She is a very hard-working woman.  Above all, she is a complete entrepreneur.  She is a bookkeeper.  In her free time she also sells embroidered slippers.

She is asking for the loan to be able to buy slippers and beads.  She will do this so that she can continue making embroidered slippers.  This way she will continue working as she is now doing.

loans.use: to buy slippers and beads to make embroidered slippers.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Mr Koffi âgé de 31ans est marié et père de 02 enfants de 3 et 1an. Pour assurer un avenir radieux à la famille, il a démarré la vente des chaussures dans un marché de la place. Son cinquiéme crédit l'aidera à acheter plus de chaussures afin de renforcer son activité. Les gains tirés de la vente servira à Mr Koffi de devenir grossiste et aider ses progénitures à s'épanouir.
texts.en: Koffi is 31 years old, married, and the father of two children, ages 3 and 1.  In order to provide a bright future to his family, he started to sell shoes at a local market.  This fifth loan will allow him to buy more shoes and to boost his activity.  Koffi will use the earnings from his business to become a wholesaler and to help his children develop and thrive.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 23ans, Komlan pour subvenir à ses besoins revend des documents et fait des copies dans une boutique aux clients. Pour l'avancement de son activité, il sollicite un premier prêt pour acheter une photocopieuse. Le gain tiré de l'activité l'aidera à se prendre en charge et agrandir son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Komlan, age 23, is a young man who makes a living reselling documents and making copies for his customers in a shop.  In order to further develop his activity, he is requesting a first loan to buy a photocopy machine.  With the earnings from his business, he will be able to meet all his personal needs and to increase his stock of goods.

loans.use: to buy a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Rem is a 27-year-old mother of two children, both of whom are in school. Rem farms rice and works for others for a fee, earning about 37,000KHR per day. She can manage to save about 20,000KHR each day. 

Rem has been with VisionFund for one loan, which helped her better support her family. With the loan repaid, she is now leading her group to request a new one. Rem will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Erkingul

texts.ru: Эркингуль, 23 года, замужем, имеет 3 сыновей. В 2012 году в поиске доходов для своей семьи Эркингуль стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Бизнес начала с 20,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Эркингуль достигла заметных успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сомов (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Эркингуль имеется: 1 дойная корова, 15 овец. По хозяйству помогает вся семья. Эркингуль харакктеризуют только с положительной стороны, она честна, исполнительна и обязательна. Знает всю технологию животноводства и полеводства. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эркингуль обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом на покупку минеральных удобрений, семян. Доходы от кредита Эркингуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого хозяйства, увеличить поголовье скота, а также в будущем планирует построить новый большой сарай для содержания хозяйства.
texts.en: Erkingul is 23 years old, married, and has three sons. In 2012, in search of an income for her family, Erkingul began practicing crop farming and livestock breeding. She started this business with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her indefatigable effort and intensive work, Erkingul achieved remarkable success in developing her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). She currently has 1 milk cow and 15 sheep on her farm. Her entire family helps her with her farm. Erkingul is characterized only by positive attributes: she is honest, resourceful and responsible. She knows all the technical aspects of livestock breeding and crop farming. For the purpose of further developing her business, Erkingul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. Erkingul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her small farm and increasing the size of her herd. She also plans to build a new large barn for housing her livestock in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Mujeres Capaces Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Mujeres Capaces” está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde  gracias al trabajo de ellas están mejorando su situación de pobreza.
La Sra. Gladys, una de ellas, tiene un Kiosko muy bien surtido en su casa y con una buena clientela formada se encuentra mejorando su situación pero de igual manera está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar golosinas, bebidas, jugos, y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por sus seres queridos. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Capaces' [Capable Women] group is in its first cycle of the women’s committee program.  They are also completing the elimination of poverty survey.  Thanks to their work, they are improving their poverty situation.

Gladys is one of them.  She has a very well-stocked kiosk at her house.  She has a good, established customer base.  She is improving her situation.  However, she also has to struggle to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy candy, drinks, and juices, among other items.  This way she will be able to continue struggling for her loved ones.  She is grateful for the help that she is receiving in order to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy candy, drinks, and juices, among other items.

loans.name: Gulbarchyn

texts.ru: Гульбарчын 37 лет, замужем и имеет 3 детей. Семья с удовольствием помогает по хозяйству. В поисках  источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2000 году Гульбарчын начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 10,000 сомов (KGS), на сегодняшний день ее хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сомов (KGS). В хозяйстве содержит: 1 дойную корову, 10 овец. Также имеет земельный надел, где в основном выращивает -арбузы, хлопок, кукурузу. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульбарчын обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом на закупку удобрений, семян и клеенки для постройки теплицы. Доходы от кредита Гульбарчын планирует использовать для постройки большого сарая и сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulbarchyn is 37 years old, married, and has three children. Her family helps her with her farming with pleasure. In search of a source of income for her family, Gulbarchyn began practicing crop farming and livestock breeding. She started this business in 2000 with 1,000 som (KGS). Her farm currently bring her a monthly profit of 10,000 som (KGS). She has 1 milk cow and 10 sheep on her farm. She also has a plot of land on which she mainly grows watermelons, cotton and corn. For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulbarchyn turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and oilcloth for building a greenhouse. Gulbarchyn plans to use the earnings from the loan to build a large barn and make home repairs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and oilcloth for building a greenhouse.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina, a widow and mother of three, has been operating her farm for more than two years. She earns a good living from this. With her generated revenue, she is able to provide solely for her family. Being the bread winner of the family, she needs to work hard to meet the needs of her five children. She has had to work hard with determination to provide a better income and improve her family's living conditions. To improve the farm, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer. In the future, Lina hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Gulkaiyr

texts.ru: Гулкайыр 23 года, замужем, детей двое. Гулкайыр имеет среднее образование, занимается полеводством и животноводством. Гулкайыр по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая, знает всю технологию ведения сельскохозяйственного бизнеса. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулкайыр в хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова и 5 овец, а также имеет земельный надел, на котором в основном выращивается  хлопок и кукуруза. Ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулкайыр обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку удобрений и семян. Доходы от кредита Гулкайыр планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а также, в будущем хочет построить жилой дом.
texts.en: Gulkaiyr is 23 years old, married and has two children. Gulkaiyr has a secondary education. She practices crop farming and livestock breeding. Gulkaiyr is calm, well-adjusted and hardworking by nature. She knows all the technical aspects of running an agricultural business. Her husband and children help her with this business. As an additional source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding. She started this business with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulkaiyr's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow and 5 sheep on her farm. She also has a plot of land on which she primarily grows cotton and corn. This business brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) per month, which mainly serves to cover the family's food expenses and daily living needs. For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulkaiyr turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. Gulkaiyr plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also wants to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang is 41 years old and married with four children. She and her family live in a village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 20 years, earning about 50,000 KHR per day to support their family. 

Neang is a fourth cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group ask for a loan. Neang wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to improve the growth of her crops and produce higher yields in order to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 47 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock such as coffee, biscuits, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Cecilia has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as coffee, biscuits, softdrinks, etc., to sell

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn is 42 years old and married. She lives with her husband and six children in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. 

She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and cassava. Having been in this business for six years, together they can earn about KHR 90,000 per day.

Lorn is new with VisionFund this cycle. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and she will use a portion of it to pay for labor fees. She hopes to grow her business and grow more crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio is very dedicated to his family, because for him the most important thing is to improve their living conditions for their well being. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, urea, and other agricultural supplies to maintain his rice field that he has cultivated. 
 
He is grateful for the support and confidence that Kiva and ASKI have given him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea, and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jonafe

texts.en: Jonafe helps her husband operate a buy-and-sell of bananas business in her community. They are from the village of Bayabas, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur where they grow bananas and other crops as their main source of income. In 2007, Jonafe joined GDMPC and gained access to financial services and help to improve her living conditions. She has successfully repaid a previous loan and used the generated income to purchase additional products.  Recently, Jonafe took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma helps her husband operate a tricycle transport business. Nelma has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns a good income for the family's needs.  She has five children and some are still studying. She has had to work double time in order to provide them with a better education than she had.

In 2010, Nelma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve her ability to engage in business activities. With her generated income, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for repair. Recently, she took a new loan again to cover the costs for motorcycle repair. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motorcycle repair

loans.name: Prelina

texts.en:
Prelina has owned and operated a specialized retail store for many years. With her generated income, she successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business, purchasing goods to sell. Aside from this, the main source of income for the family is farming. She helps her husband working in their own farm, too.

In 2009, Prelina joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer in order to have a greener farm. She hopes and prays to have a bountiful harvest this season.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a widow parent of three children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and vegetable vending. Delia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as shorts, shirts, slippers, etc., to sell for her buy and sell ready to wear products business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as shorts, shirts, slippers, etc., to sell

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio is 63 years old, from Bayabo East in the Philippines. He is married and has six children. Julio has a farming business that he has been running for the past ten years. He has applied for his 9th loan from ASKI to enable him buy farm inputs like seedlings and also to pay for labor charges. He will use the profits to expand his business.

He hopes to upgrade his farm business in the near future to help boost his income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seedlings and pay for labor charges

loans.name: Merry

texts.en:
Merry is a 46-year-old woman who is married to Simon, a 51-year-old entrepreneur. They have been blessed with five children; Roswati, 25, a worker; Ratna, 21, in college; Yoas, 18, Vocational High School; Rosi, 12, Junior High school; and the last one is Imon, 11, Elementary School. 

Merry's primary job is being a farmer.  She plants green beans and paddy rice.  Merry has a plan to initiate a small business of selling cakes at home but she doesn't have adequate capital to do so. Therefore she asked for a loan from TLM amounting of IDR 5,000,000. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer and cake ingredients such as a sack of wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. Merry is expecting that the business income can help her and her husband to cover her children's educational expenditures.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and also cake ingredients such as a sack of wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 51 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Milagros is borrowing PHP 40,000 through ASKI to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Milagros has been farming rice for three years, and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emelia works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells coconut wine in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling prawns. Emelia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell for her business.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Kulbakira

texts.ru: Кулбакира, 48 лет, замужем. Имеет пятерых детей, трое из которых самостоятельны и живут отдельно. У Кулбакиры среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Кулбакира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1992 года занимается животноводством, она разводит коров и торгует молоком, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кулбакира смогла развить и расширить свой бизнес, ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулбакира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку коров.  Доходы от кредита Кулбакира планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего хозяйства, постройку сарая, а также в будущем хочет дать достойное образование своим детям.
texts.en: Kulbakira is 48 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are adults and live separately. Kulbakira has a secondary education. She has a good reputation amongst her neighbors. They describe her as a kind and hardworking woman. As the main source of income for her family, Kulbakira practices livestock breeding. She raises cows and sells their milk. She started this business in 1992 with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kulbakira's hard work, she has been able to develop and expand her business.  Her business brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) per month, which mainly serves to cover the family's food expenses and daily needs. For the purpose of further developing her business, Kulbakira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows. Kulbakira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business and building a barn. She also wants to give her children a good education in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Yerni

texts.en:
Yerni is a 29-year-old single woman. She has been operating a kiosk business for 5 months. Actually, Yerni just came back from Surabaya, east Java, where she worked for three years as a housemaid. Yerni initiated her kiosk business by using three years worth of her savings. She sells a variety of daily items such as instant noodles, soap, detergent, snacks, etc. The business income is used to help her parents in fulfilling the needs of her family.

As the business is in a strategic location near the road side, Yerni can easily get customers. Currently, her business is growing well and she wants to add more goods in order to fulfill the demands of her customers. Her dreams led her to apply for a loan from TLM, as the interest rate is reasonable. She submitted the application and asked for a loan of IDR 3,000,000. This loan will be spent on buying rice, sugar, and wheat flour in bulk.

loans.use: to buy kiosk stock such as a sack of rice, a sack of wheat, and a sack of sugar

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
El llamado Nueva Estrella  está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, además de trabajar en mejorar sus vidas, forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien hace bijouterie para la venta. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que a través de su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, trabaja todos los días para poder ganarse el sustento del día a día.
Pide este préstamo para poder seguir trabajando y luchando como lo viene haciendo, ya que quiere comprar canutillos, hilos, pinzas y demás, con lo que podrá seguir ganándose el sustento.
texts.en:
The group known as "Nueva Estrella" is in their third cycle with the Woman's Committee program. Besides working to improve their lives they are taking part in the Poverty Stoplight program.

One of the members is Maria who makes costume jewellery to sell. She is a hard-working person who through her efforts is getting ahead. She works every day to support herself. She is requesting a loan to be able to continue working and striving as she has been doing. She wants to buy cord, thread, booby pins, etc, which will be used to earn her sustenance.

loans.use: to buy cord, thread, bobby pins, etc.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is married with two children.  He owns and operates farmland, where he plants and harvests coconuts to earn a living. He has been doing this for many years, earning well for the family. His previous loan for his farm was successfully repaid with his generated income. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizers in order to continue improving his farm. In the future, Rogelio wants to purchase an additional motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers

loans.name: Abelita

texts.en:
An $800 is offered to Abelita. She is married and has four children. To improve her business, she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as oil, milk, cigarettes, noodles, a refrigerator, beer, fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko, and bread. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Abelita independent because she can be responsible for herself and for helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy some additional supplies, such as oil, milk, cigarettes, noodles, a refrigerator, etc.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Aged 38 years, Tha is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She earns a living through growing rice. She has been doing this for 15 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 23,000 per day from the current business and they are able to save about KHR 17,000 each day for the future. 
This is the third loan for Tha with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans, which have help her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. Tha wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to produce more crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling livestock. Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 36 years old and married with two children who are in school. Eden works very hard to provide for them.

Eden runs a buy-and-sell electrical supply in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional electrical supplies to resell.

Eden has been in this business for 12 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional electrical supplies to resell.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, quiere ser un abogado excelente que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su conocimiento.
Él se está dedicando a sus estudios para poder sobresalir y ayudar también a su familia por medio de su esfuerzo.
Claudio pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, ya que así podrá seguir estudiando y luchando por ser un abogado que ayude a las demás personas.
texts.en: Claudio is studying Law. He wants to be an excellent lawyer who can help other people with his knowledge. He is dedicated to his studies as a way to get ahead and to help his family through his efforts. Claudio is requesting a loan to pay his university tuition so he can continue studying and striving to become a lawyer who helps others.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en: Arsenio is a 57-year-old man who is married with four children living in Tumauini, Philippines. He has been in commercial agriculture rice farming for the last eight years. He started his farming business to get more income for providing for basic needs. He is challenged by the unpredictable weather changes, especially during the dry season, when his income reduces in line with the harvests. He is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs and expand his rice field to meet his dreams.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and expand his rice field to meet his dreams

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a mother of five. She operates a royal beauty products business as a distributor in her village to make a living. Aside from this, her husband earns from their transportation services business. 

For three years running the business, she has been earning well to support the needs of her children, and was able to sustain it. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy additional beauty products to resell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to resell, such as canned goods, eggs, chips, noodles, etc.

Elizabeth has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to resell, such as canned goods, eggs, chips, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jennilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jennilyn works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Jennilyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her business.

Jennilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap, oil, vinegar, etc. to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 39 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns income from coconut wine vending and pre-paid mobile loading. She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soap, oil, vinegar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Sally

texts.en: Ma. Sally is a hard-working mother who helps her husband in managing their rice farming business. She is 60 years old and has four adult-aged children. Being responsible parents, she and her husband aim to improve their farming business to give their family a better living. To further improve their business, Ma. Sally is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to pay for the expenses incurred in harvesting rice and drying it on the pavement. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted so they will be able to improve their farming business.

loans.use: to pay for the expenses incurred in harvesting and drying the rice on the pavement

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Luchadoras está en su 5º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá seguir creciendo y luchando por mejorar sus vidas.
Venilda es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos variados, y así con el día a día está luchando para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Venilda pide este préstamo para poder comprar más cosméticos, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y quiere poder seguir con sus ventas cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad de crecer que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Luchadoras" is in their 5th cycle of the Woman's Committee Program. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey which will help them continue to grow and strive to improve their lives.

Venilda is one member of the group. She sells a variety of cosmetics and day by day struggles to give her loved ones all that she couldn't have. Venilda is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics as she has lots of orders. She wants to continue with her sales and fill her clients' requests.
