He has decided to ask for a loan to buy the main agricultural materials: fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, etc. He hopes to have favorable results, since he doesn't have another source of income. He trusts in God that he will obtain an abundant harvest which will allow him to keep bringing home the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Veranissie Elizabeth

texts.es: Veranissie de 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella tiene un negocio de Venta de ropa, en donde ofrece variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc. Una zona muy transitada y conocida por los habitantes del municipio. El puesto de Veranissie es muy visitado ya que las personas siempre encuentran lo que buscan, por la amabilidad y el buen trato es lo más importante. Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio por lo que ha decidido hacer un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar más ropa por mayor  y tener más variedad de prendas de vestir Como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas, shorts, entre otros. Con el propósito de atraer a más compradores y lograr un mayor nivel de ventas así como un mayor nivel de ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Veranissie is 34 years old. She lives with her family group in her own home. She has a business selling clothes in which she offers items of clothing such as skirts, dresses, blouses, pants, etc. in a place that is well trafficked and known by the town's residents. A lot of people visit Veranissie's spot because people always find what they are looking for there and for the friendliness and good service, which is the most important thing. Her dream is to see her business grow and so she has decided to take out a loan with INTEGRAL so she can buy more clothing wholesale and have more of a variety of clothing items such as pants, skirts, t-shirts, blouses, shorts, and more. She wants to attract more buyers and achieve a higher level of sales and income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina works hard to support her family.  Celestina is married and has a dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additonal fish to make dried fish.  Celestina has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Celestina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additonal fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is married with three children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Dolores is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Dolores has a banana business in the Philippines.  Dolores requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Dolores has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Vath's Group

texts.en:
Vath is a 23-year-old mother of one child and earns a living through farming rice and growing cassava.  She has been in this business for five years and the current business earns her about 34,000 KHR per day to feed the family. 

This is Vath's second loan cycle with VisionFund.  She wisely and successfully used her first loan from VisionFund to better support her family’s living needs and the business'.  Vath is now leading her group to ask for a loan.  As the leader, Vath is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.  She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Seangly's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Seangly is now 57 years old and married.  She has three children. Seangly and her husband are farmers who grow sesame and tobacco.  Having been in the business for 27 years, they are able to make daily earnings of 38,000 KHR and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day. 

This is the second loan for Seangly with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.  She hopes to extend her sesame and tobacco plantation and also grow her crops healthily to make more income to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Noern's Group

texts.en:
Noem lives in a rural village of the Dambe district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living,  Noern, 36, is married with two children.  She and her husband grow cassava as the main business for the family’s income.  Having been in the business for 18 years, they can earn about 50,000 KHR per day to respond to the family’s needs and manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day. 

Noern has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past two loans to improve her family’s livelihood.  Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.  Noern wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.  She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn a larger income so as to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es: Blanca  vive en casa propia con sus hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar, Blanca es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Blanca solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Blanca  lives in her own home with her children who are in school. Blanca is a responsible and hardworking mother who has been able to get  her family ahead. She has a store that sells food such as bread, beverages, oils, vegetables, fruit, snacks and also staple products such as soap and shampoo and more. The business is in her house. Blanca is asking for a loan so she can better stock her store and serve her customers better and thus improve her sales. Her priority is getting her household ahead.

loans.use: to buy bread, beverages, oils, vegetables, fruit, snacks, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Saramaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SARAMAYA ont en moyenne  41ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BELEKAN/LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers et des céréales.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SARAMAYA sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire. NANA KADIA 3ème femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 pièces de Wax, 20 jouets pour enfant, 3 cartons de savon, 20 paires de chaussures en plastique et 20 foulards. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de36000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: The women of the SARAMAYA group are, on average, 41 years old, have six children, and all live in traditional extended families in BELEKAN/LAFIABOUGOU, a neighborhood in SAN/SEGOU (fourth largest administrative region in the republic of Mali). These women know each other through close family ties and are all involved in the purchase and sale of diverse products and grains. Subsequent to having successfully reimbursed previous loans, they are asking for their third loan. NANA KADIA, seen third from the left, plans to use the loan to purchase five pieces of was, 20 kids toys, 3 boxes of soap, 20 pairs of plastic shoes and 20 scarves. She stocks up on materials in Bamako, and sell the, to a variety of clients (both men and women) for cash and credit. She hopes to earn monthly profits of 36 000 FCFA, which she will use to take care of the health, nutrition, clothing and education needs of her family; the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: purchase diverse articles

loans.name: Sebeallaye Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SEBEALLAYE ont en moyenne  36ans, 6enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BELEKAN/LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des condiments, des boissons  et des céréales.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SEBEALLAYE sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire. ANTA 3ème femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  5 pièces de Wax, 15 jouets d’enfants, 5 cartons de savon, 10 paires de chaussures en plastique et 20 paquets de mèche. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 28 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: The women of the SEBEALLAYE group are, on average, 36 years old, with 6 children, and all live in traditional extended families in BELEKAN/LAFIABOUGOU, a neighborhood in SAN/SEGOU (fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). These women met through strong family ties, and all work in purchase and sale of diverse products, condiments, drinks and grains. Subsequent to having successfully reimbursed previous loans, they are now asking for a third loan. ANTA, third women from the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to purchase 5 pieces of was, 15 kids toys, 5 boxes of soap, 10 pairs of plastic shoes and 20 packs of hair. She stocks up in Bamako, and sells to a clientele of men and women for cash and credit. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 28 000 FCFA, which she will use to cover the health, nutrition, clothing and education needs of her family; the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: purchase diverse articles

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Edwina works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and raising pigs. Edwina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase materials like wood, paints, etc for her furniture making business.

Edwina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wood, paints, etc for her furniture shop.

loans.name: Then's Group

texts.en:
Then is aged 34 years old and is a married mother of four children, two of whom are in school while her other two are too young for school. She and her husband have made a living through farming rice for 17 years, earning about 26,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
This is the fourth loan for Then with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Then wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops to sell it for a good price to make her family’s living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Balimayadjourou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BALIMAYADJOUROU ont en moyenne  40ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des condiments et des céréales.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BALIMAYADJOUROU sont à leur 14ème  prêt solidaire. DJENEBA femme au milieu sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 mètres de tissus légers, 30 paires de boucle d’oreille, 2 douzaines d’assiette. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 41 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: The women of the BALIMAYADJOUROU group are, on average, 40 years old and have 4 children. All of them live in traditional extended families in KIMPARANA/SEGOU (fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). These women met through strong family ties, and are all involved in the purchase and sale of divese productions, condiments and grains. Subsequent to having successfully repaid previous loans, they are asking for their 14th loan. DJENEBA, seen in the middle of the group photo, plans to use the loan to purchase 50 meter of light cloth, 30 pairs of earrings, and 2 dozen plates. She stocks up nearby, and sells to a mixed customer base (men and women) for cash and credit. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 41 000 FCFA, that she will use to cover the health, nutrition and education costs of her family; the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: purchase diverse articles

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell in her banana business.

Elma has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from selling vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure a future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emely works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Emely is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc for her food vending banana business.

Emely has been sustaining her business activities through the past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw business for the last ten years. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore Sonia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sonia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is married and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is running a fuel station where he sells petrol, diesel, kerosene oil and LPG. His shop is situated at the front of a road so a lot of vehicles pass through his shop. 
According to the rapid increase in the demand for fuel; her husband wants to increase his stock on a daily basis.
He wants to ensure a secure future for his children by generating additional income.
This is the reason Nusrat has requested a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy the described inventories.
Nusrat is very pleased with this co-operation; she is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy petrol, diesel and LPG cylinders for a fuel station.

loans.name: Roen's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Moung Russey district, Battambang province, Roen is 54 years old and married. She has seven children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, Roen has been working as a rice farmer who grows rice on almost 2 hectare of farmland. To supplement the income, she also works as a paid worker in the local area. The current business earns her about 45,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Roen has been with VisionFund for six cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,400,000KHR each. As the leader, Roen is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Fedelina has been in this business for 10 years. Fedelina earns more income from fish vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a responsible housewife who helps her husband to generate income. She is 32 years old and has only one child. 
She buys and resells live fish in the market while her husband cultivates their farmland. She aims to strengthen her business in order to earn a higher income. Due to financial insufficiency, she would like to request a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy more stocks of live fish to resell in the market. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of live fish to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rogelene

texts.en:
Rogelene is 33 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Rogelene requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.  Rogelene has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 13 times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Rogelene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her business.  She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly, aged 40 years, is married and has six children. She lives with her husband in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She and her husband have earned a living through growing rice for several years. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day from the current business and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting expenses.

Ly’s group consists of two members who live in the same area, and she is a fourth-cycle client while the other member is a second-cycle client with VisionFund. The past loans that Ly successfully paid back have helped her family support their business and improve living conditions. Now leading this group to apply for a loan, Ly will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 39-year-old man who is married. They are blessed with four children.

Richard has been working as a farmer for five years in his village. He is a very loving and dedicated person; he makes sure that he can provide all the needs of his family. 

He is asking a loan amounting to Php 35,000 to buy seed to grow and fertilizer for his business. 

In the future, Richard hopes that he can expand his business so that he can provide for all the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed to grow and fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Maideen Galcier

texts.en:
Maideen Glacier is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Maideen Glacier is 24 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. Maideen Glacier is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Maideen Glacier has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Maideen Glacier would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. 
Her husband (not pictured for personal reasons) is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last one year. From the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Saira has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Saira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 47-year-old married woman; she is a responsible mother and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is involved in a scrap-dealing business and deals with scrap goods such as iron, plastic accessories and waste papers. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and selling it to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have the amount to buy scrap goods and does not even have scrap in stock to sell to generate income.

Therefore, Shamshad has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. 

She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods to sell to the recycling factories.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Marivic has been in this business for four years now, and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

In the future, Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Elluminada

texts.en:
Elluminada is married and has four children. She raises livestock in the Philippines.

Elluminada requested a loan from NWTF for 1,800 PHP, which she will use to buy a solar lamp to have backup light in case of emergency. She is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Phoung's Group

texts.en:
Phoung is 30 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. The sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and working as a paid worker. She and her husband have been in these businesses for several years. She earns about 25,000 KHR ar day to meet her family’s need. 

Phoung is the leader of Phoung's Group. She requested her fourth loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She successfully used the past loans to relieve her family’s financial burden and increase family’s income. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is the age of 42, and she is the mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, where she is a housewife and looks after her family at home.

Her husband works selling dairy products like milk, curd and butter. He owns a small dairy farm that consists of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man and he manages his household necessities from his earnings from milk sales. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients.

He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income, so Zubaida demanded a loan. In this way she can support her husband's business. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk sales

loans.name: Norbita

texts.en:
Norbita is 45 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc.

Norbita has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing and raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Rithy's Group

texts.en:
Rithy is aged 35 years old and married. She lives with her husband and one son in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Her son is still in school.

To make a living, she has been growing rice and various kinds of vegetables. Having been in this business for 15 years, together they can earn about 48,000 KHR per day. 

Rithy is a fifth-loan-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her family’s living conditions. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides, seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her business and make more crops to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Khorm's Group

texts.en:
Living a wooden house in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Khorm is 49 years old and married with three children. The main source of her family’s income is rice farming. She has been in this business for almost 20 years. With the current business, she can earn about 50,000 KHR per day. 

This is the sixth loan for Khorm with VisionFund and she has successfully paid back all of her previous loans. She successfully used the past loan to improve her livelihood. Now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 56 years old, and she is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional meat, vegetable, fish, spices, and other ingredients. 

Carmelita has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat, vegetable, fish, spices, and other ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 37-year-old woman living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a moto-rickshaw. Its body is made of polyester which is not enough strong to bear jerks over the roads. Now the rickshaw's body needs to be replaced with a new one because it rattles during driving. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his moto-rickshaw.

This is the reason Abida has requested a loan so her husband can maintain the rickshaw body so that he can drive it smoothly.  Abida thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 57 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.  Patricia has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Patricia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 43 years old, married and has nine children, four of whom who are in school.

Antonia is in the agricultural business farming corn and peanuts in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries. Antonia has been farming corn and peanuts for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Antonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Sarom is 58 years old and married. She and her husband have struggled to feed her six children by farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for three years, the current business earns her approximately 48,000 KHR per day. 

Sarom has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to renovate her house. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia junto con sus hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer  responsable, honesta  y trabajadora. Maria está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en: 42-year-old Maria lives with her children in their own home.  She has worked in agriculture for a number of years, growing beans and corn.  When her crops are harvested, she stores them in the barns shown on the photo and then sells them to cover her household expenses. She is a responsible, honest and hardworking woman. Maria is applying for a loan to buy supplies for her crops such as fertiliser, manure, seeds, fertiliser etc. because her current income is not sufficient to cover these expenses.  The loan will, therefore, enable her to boost her income and achieve greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, manure, seeds, fertiliser, etc.

loans.name: Henry Alexander

texts.es: Henry de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el posee un negocio de venta de carteras y cinchos ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Henry esta solicitando un crédito para la compra mas mercadería por mayor y asi seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 40-year-old Henry lives with his wife and daughter in their own home. He runs a business selling purses and belts in the market close to where he lives and his earnings cover some of the household expenses. Henry is seeking this loan to buy more merchandise in bulk so he can continue running his business and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy purses and belts in bulk

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She is in the agricultural business farming peanuts in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. 

Vilma requested her fourth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Bomnorng's Group

texts.en:
30 years old, Bomnorng is single. She makes a living by farming rice in the village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Bomnorng’s group consists of two members, and this is her first microloan with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto lives in Tumauini, which is located in the province of Isabela. His principal economic activity is agriculture. He grows rice. He is a responsible and friendly person. At this time, he needs a loan to buy seeds. Modesto is grateful to the investors for the loan, and he promises to make his payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Eugen

texts.en:
Eugen is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Eugen has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

Eugen aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 31 years old and has two children who attend school. Analiza is married. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Analiza requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Analiza has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BEN ont en moyenne  42 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des condiments et des céréales. Les femmes du groupe BEN sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire. SALI femme debout au milieu sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 pièces d’uni Wax, 10 poupées, 10 jouets pour enfants. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
BEN is a group of women who average 42 years of age and four children each. They all live in extended traditional families in KIMPARANA, Segou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women share ties of kinship. They buy and sell various merchandise, condiments and cereals. This is their first group loan. 

SALI is the group member standing in the center in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy 3 pieces of uni-wax pagnes, 10 dolls, and 10 children’s toys. She buys her merchandise locally. She sells for cash, often on credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Sali expects to earn an average monthly profit of 20,500 FCFA, which she will use to pay for healthcare, food and tuition. Any remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Walter Bladimir

texts.es: Walter de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la crianza de cerdos que posteriormente comercializa. El negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia por lo que cuenta con un lugar muy apto para este tipo de trabajo, Walter es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora quien ha sacado adelante a su familia, desde hace varios años que se  dedica a este trabajo, el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco, a pesar de esto él cuenta con una cantidad de clientes muy aceptable, por lo que desea contar con mayor cantidad de cerdos para extender aún más su negocio, es por esto que él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir comprando: concentrado para cerdos, vitaminas, y así mismo mejorar el lugar en el cual habitan sus crías, de manera que el estándar de calidad sea aún más alto y así brindar un mejor servicio, el cual le permita mejorar sus ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Walter, age 35, lives in his own house with his wife and son.  He raises pigs and later sells them.  His business is located where he lives because he has a very suitable place for this type of work.  Walter is a very responsible and hard-working person who has gotten his family ahead.

He has been doing this work for several years.  It has been growing little by little.  In spite of that, he has a very acceptable number of customers.  Therefore, he wishes to have more pigs to expand his business even more.

That is why he is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy concentrated feed for pigs and vitamins.  He will also improve the place where the pigs live.  He will do this in such a way that the quality will be even higher.  This way he will provide better service.  This will allow him to improve his earnings and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for pigs and vitamins and to improve the place where the pigs live.

loans.name: Mercedes Faustino

texts.es: Don Mercedes de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el posee un negocio de enderezado y pintura ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites, y demás herramientas para seguir con su trabajo y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Mercedes is 45 years old and lives with his family in his own home. He has a business doing body work and painting located at his residence. He manages to pay some of the household expenses with his income. He is requesting a loan to buy paint, varnish, oils and other tools to continue with his work. he wants to make more profit and provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy paint, varnish, oils and other tools.

loans.name: María Regina

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora, madre de seis hijos, quien se dedica a atender su tienda de productos básicos de la canasta familiar y recarga de celulares; adicionalmente compra café que cultivan sus vecinos, con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y aportar a los gastos familiares. María invertirá el crédito en la compra de café, para comercializarlo en la cooperativa de caficultores y sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir aportando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
María is a hard-working mother of 6 children. She takes care of her store selling basic food items and recharging cellphones. She also buys coffee that her neighbors grow with the aim of increasing her revenues and contributing to the household expenses.

María will invest the loan in buying coffee to sell to the coffee growers' cooperative. She dreams of improving her quality of living and to continue to contribute financially to her family.

loans.use: to buy coffee from her neighbors to sell to a coffee cooperative

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Tulio es un hombre de 69 años, viudo y padre de tres hijos, que ha dedicado casi toda su vida a la producción agrícola, principalmente al cultivo y venta de flores, en un municipio del oriente Antioqueño. Con el crédito comprará insumos agrícolas para mejorar y mantener en buenas condiciones su cultivo, mejorando la utilidad. Actualmente vive solo y se le dificulta el traslado hacia el cultivo, pero aun así se esfuerza y sueña con ver sus flores más bonitas cada día.
texts.en:
Julio, age 69, is a widower with three children.  He has devoted almost his entire life to agricultural production.  He primarily grows and sells flowers in a municipality to the east of Antioqueño.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies to improve his crops and to keep them in good condition.  This way he will be improving the profitability.

He currently lives alone.  It is difficult for him to get to the crops.  Even so, he puts forth great effort, and he dreams of seeing his flowers being more beautiful every day.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es: Romelia es una mujer de 60 años de edad, casada, responsable y muy trabajadora, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 4 son independientes, tiene un hijo discapacitado. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de la ciudad esta actividad la viene realizando desde que tiene memoria. Ella necesita el préstamo para abastecerse de verduras para la venta. Su sueño es poder sostener su hogar hasta que sus fuerzas lo permitan, que en su negocio le vaya muy bien y que su último hijo termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Romelia, age 60, is married and has six children.  Four of them are independent.  She has a disabled child.  She is a responsible and very hard-working woman.

She sells vegetables at the market in the city.  She has been engaged in this business activity for as long as she can remember.

She needs the loan to stock up on vegetables to sell.

Her dream is to be able to support her household as long as she has the strength to do so.  She dreams of her business going very well and that her last child completes his education.

loans.use: to stock up on vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mary Estefania

texts.es: Mary, es una mujer de 29 años de edad, casada, alegre, trabajadora y responsable, tiene dos hijos un niño de 10 años y una niña de  5 años de edad. Ella tiene un restaurante en un mercado de la zona, ella prepara encebollados, pescado frito entre otros. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para preparar sus platos, como arroz, papas entre otros. Su sueño es poder comprarse una casa y terminar de educar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Mary is 29 years old, married and has two children, a 10 year old boy and a 5 year old girl. She is happy, hard-working and responsible. She has a restaurant in the local market where she prepares stews, fried fish, etc. She needs the loan to buy ingredients to prepare her dishes, like rice, potatoes, etc. Her dream is to be able to buy a house and finish her children's education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, potatoes, etc. to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  45 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales et de la restauration. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 13ème  prêt solidaire. ASTAN 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 paniers de tomate, 10Kg d’oignon, 25Kg de sel, 25Kg de riz, 1carton de spaghetti, 10Kg d’haricot, 2 paquets de Cube Maggi et 10Litres d’huile pour des fins de restauration. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes (plats alimentaires), à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 42.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group BENKADI average 34 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in KIMPARANA/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship. They have businesses buying and selling condiments and grains, and they work in food service.

After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group BENKADI are now on their thirteen solidarity loan. 

ASTAN, who is the first woman standing from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 3 baskets of tomatoes, 10 kg of onions, 25 kg of salt, 25 kg of rice, a box of spaghetti, 10 kg of beans, 2 packets of Cube Maggi [bouillon cubes], and 10 liters of oil for her restaurant. She gets her supplies locally. She makes her sales (prepared foods) to men and women customers paying with cash and often with credit.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 42,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and education, and the rest will be reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: José Aníbal

texts.es: José, convive con su pareja y tienen un niño de dos años, desde muy joven ha trabajado en tiendas, por ello su experiencia, inició su  propio negocio en un municipio del departamento, pero por motivos de violencia social, se vio en la necesidad de trasladarse para la ciudad, donde continúa con dicha actividad, José sueña con tener un negocio más amplio y consolidado, con el préstamo que adquiera, tendrá  la oportunidad de comprar mercancía de mucha variedad para ofrecerle a sus clientes un mejor y eficaz servicio, incrementando el capital para con este darle a su familia todo lo que necesiten para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: José and his partner have a two-year old son.  José started working in retail businesses when he was just a lad and he used the experience he gained to start his own business.  He opened his first business in a small town but the violence there forced him to the city where he started over.  José wants to build a bigger, more-established business and this loan will help.  He'll be able to buy a wider range of merchandise and deliver a better and more efficient service to his customers.  The investment will allow him to gradually build capital so that he can better provide for his family.

loans.use: to stock his retail business.

loans.name: Baiyzkan

texts.ru: Байызкан 54 года, она замужем, есть 3 сына, двое из которых самостоятельны и живут отдельно. Байызкан имеет средне-специальное образование, Соседи описывают ее как ответственную, целеустремленную и доброжелательную. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие.  Байызкан в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 1996 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Байызкан в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 3 лошади  и 10 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,8 ГА, на котором выращивает фасоль. Ее сельскохозяйственная деятельность приносит около 10,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц, от продажи фасоли, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Байызкан вырастить и обустроить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Байызкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку минеральных удобрений и семян фасоли. Доходы от кредита Байызкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет сделать ремонт в хозяйственных помещениях.
texts.en: Baiyzkan is 54 years old, married, and has three sons, two of whom are grown-up and live on their own. Baiyzkan has a secondary-specialized education. Her neighbors describe her as responsible, goal-driven and considerate. Her husband and children help her with her business. Their family is very close-knit and they have good relationships with one another. As an additional source of income for her family, Baiyzkan practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business in 1996 with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Baiyzkan's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 3 horses and 10 sheep on her farm, as well as a 2.8 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans. Her agricultural business brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of beans, which mainly serves to cover the family's food expenses and daily needs. The earnings from her business allow Baiyzkan to raise and provide for her children. For the purpose of further developing her business, Baiyzkan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and bean seeds. Baiyzkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her farm. She also wants to make repairs on her home in the future.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and bean seeds.

loans.name: Oliva Del Socorro

texts.es: Oliva, es una mujer de 37 años de edad, soltera, trabajadora  y responsable, tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 2 años de edad que van a la escuela. Piensa dedicarse a la crianza de pollos ya que el pago en el trabajado en el que esta no le alcanza para sobrellevar los gastos de su hogar. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar 100 crías de pollos para alimentarlos y luego de que crezcan venderlos. Su sueño es que en este negocio de crianza de pollos le vaya bien y poderles dar la educación que sus hijos se merecen.
texts.en: Oliva is 37 years old, single and mother of 3 children, aged 2, 9 and 11. The children attend school. She is hard-working and responsible. She is thinking of raising chickens as the wages from her employment do not cover her household expenses. She needs a loan to buy 100 chicks to feed them and later when they grow, sell them. Her dream is for this business to go well for her and she can provide her children with the education they deserve.

loans.use: to buy 100 chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Marcelo Fabian

texts.es: Marcelo, es un hombre de 53 años de edad, casado, tiene 7 hijos, todos ya independientes. Se dedica a preparar y vender comidas rápidas como pollo broaster  cuando hay eventos deportivos o culturales a las afueras de los sitios públicos y los vende en su carrito, también tiene un local en el cual vende ceviche y pescado frito entre otros mariscos. El necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar sus comidas, como papas, pollo, pescado entre otros. Su sueño es tener su propia casa para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 53 years old, he is married, and he has 7 children, all of whom are independent adults. He makes and sells fast food such as fried chicken.  When there are sporting events or outdoor cultural events in public places, he sells the food from his cart.  He also owns a small shop from which he sells ceviche, fried fish, and other seafood.

He is seeking a loan in order to buy ingredients to use in preparing his dishes, such as potatoes, chicken, fish, etc.  His dream is to own his own home in order to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make his dishes, such as potatoes, chicken, fish, etc.

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскул 55 лет, замужем, есть дети, но они все достаточно взрослые и проживают отдельно, поэтому в бизнес вовлечен только  супруг, который помогает обрабатывать землю. У Рыскул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1999 году с покупки скота на 50,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Рыскул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 теленка и 1 лошадь. Также имеется земельный надел размером 2,00 ГА, на котором выращивается фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рыскул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. На оставшиеся средства будут куплены удобрения, семена и ГСМ для культивации земли. Доходы от кредита Рыскул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства ремонт сарая для содержания скота.
texts.en: Ryskul is 55 years old, married and has children. However, all of her children are completely grown-up and live on their own, which is why only her husband is involved in her business. He helps till the land. Ryskul has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices crop farming and livestock breeding. She started this business in 1999 with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Ryskul's hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows, 2 calves and 1 horse on her farm. She also has a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans. Her monthly income is about 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Ryskul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy bull calves to fatten up and then sell at the market for a high price. With the remaining money she will buy fertilizer, seeds and fuel products for cultivating her land. Ryskul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She is also determined to save money to build a barn for housing her cattle.

loans.use: to buy bull calves.

loans.name: Dora Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, es una mujer de 40 años de edad, soltera, trabajadora y alegre, tiene dos hijos de 18 y 4 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos crudos en un local del mercado de la zona. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar más pollos para la venta y llegar a abastecer su demanda de clientes. Su sueño es tener un local propio donde vender sus pollos y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en: Elizabeth, 40, is a happy, hard-working woman with two children, 18- and 4-years old, respectively.  She makes a living buying and selling whole chickens.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies that she needs to meet the demand from her customers.  For the future, she wants to open a shop of her own and see her children finish school.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her retail business.

loans.name: Kanykei

texts.ru: Каныкей 24 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей.  Супруг помогает Каныкей обрабатывать землю и разводить скот.  У Каныкей - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сомов (KGS). На сегодняшний день имеется лошадь и 150 овец. Каныкей также имеет небольшой земельный надел мерою 3,0 ГА, на котором ежегодно сажает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации.  Ежемесячный доход составляет свыше 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Каныкей обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота, на часть средств она приобретет удобрения,что улучшит урожайность почвы,также купит семена фасоли и ГСМ.  Доходы от кредита Каныкей планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства для увеличения сарая.
texts.en: Kanykei is 24 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising two children. Her husband helps Kanykei cultivate the land and raise cattle. Kanykei has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding. She started this business 15 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS). She currently has a horse and 150 sheep on her farm. Kanykei also has a small 3.0 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows beans for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly income is over 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Kanykei turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy bull calves to increase the size of her herd. She will also use a portion of the funds to buy fertilizers to increase the productivity of her soil as well as to buy bean seeds and fuel. Kanykei plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to augment her barn.

loans.use: to buy bull calves.

loans.name: Deicy Julieth

texts.es: Deisy es una joven activa y trabajadora, desde que terminó el bachillerato trabajó en diferentes almacenes del municipio donde reside, por último trabaja en una cafetería y desde hace 6 meses el propietario le ofreció la oportunidad de quedarse con el negocio en vista del poco tiempo que a él le queda para atenderlo, Deisy sueña con poder terminar de cancelar esté negocio con el préstamo y surtirá comprando gaseosas, mecatos, dulces y otros;  también realizará  unas pequeñas adecuaciones,  para presentar al público un lugar de esparcimiento y agradable, donde las personas puedan visitarlo más a menudo, representando mayores ingresos para ella continuar más adelante con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Deisy is an active and hard-working young woman who since graduating from High school has worked in different stores in her municipality. The latest was a cafeteria. Six months ago the owner offered her the opportunity to buy the business, given that he wasn't going to work much longer.

Deisy dreams of being able to complete this transaction with this loan and stock the business with soft drinks, pastries, sweets, etc. Later she will make some minor renovations to present the public to a simple and agreeable space. Then her customers can visit her more often, meaning more profits so that she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: to buy stock like soft drinks, pastries, sweets, etc. and also make some small renovations.

loans.name: Marcela Del Carmen

texts.es: Marcela, es una mujer de 34 años de edad, tranquila y muy trabajadora, es casada tiene 3 hijos 2 niños y una niña, sus hijos tiene 12 y 5 años y la niña tiene 10 años. Su principal actividad es de ser vendedor ambulante vendiendo confites a las afueras de los colegios, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace ya 12 años atrás, ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Ella necesita el préstamo para abastecerse de confites para vender. Su sueño es tener su tienda propia y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Marcela is 34 years old. She is a calm and hard-working woman.  She is married and has three children - two sons and a daughter.  The boys are 12 and 5, and her daughter is 10 years old.  She sells candy by foot outside of the schools.  She began doing this work 12 years ago.  She lives with her husband and their children.

She is seeking a loan to stock up on candy for sale.  Her dream is to own her own store and she also dreams that her children will get a good education.

loans.use: to stock candy for sale.

loans.name: Duvier Steven

texts.es: Duvier es un hombre con mucho emprendimiento y entusiasmo, aprendió con un familiar a trabajar la carpintería y desde hace unos años emprendió su propio negocio el cual ya está acreditado por los buenos resultados y por el cumplimiento en la entrega de lo solicitado,  sueña con tener un buen surtido en maderas y tener su propio almacén para vender sus propios proyectos, Duvier pasó la solicitud del crédito con el fin de comprar herramientas, para el desarrollo de su actividad, resultados que le benefician en gran parte para solucionar el pago de  unos impuestos y la compra de madera e insumos para dicho trabajo, lo que le genera incrementar sus ventas y  solucionar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Duvier is an enthusiastic go-getter.  He learned carpentry from a relative and went on to start his own carpentry business.  He's known for both the quality of his work and his commitment to delivering orders when promised.  For the future, Duvier wants to secure a steady supply of materials and open a shop where he can sell finished products.  He's applying for a loan now that he will use to buy tools.  The investment will allow him to develop his business, pay taxes and buy materials for future projects.

loans.use: to buy tools for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Laura Narciza

texts.es: Laura, es una mujer de 38 años, divorciada, tiene una hija de 6 años de edad, es alegre, amable, trabajadora. Se dedica a la preparación de comida como desayunos y almuerzos para los niños de una escuela del sector. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años atrás. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar ollas y utensilios para seguir preparando la comida. Su sueño es seguir en este negocio que es lo que sabe hacer mejor y darle una buena educción a su hija.
texts.en: Laura is a 38 year-old divorced woman with a 6 year-old daughter. She is a cheerful, friendly and hard-working woman. She works preparing meals, such as breakfast and lunch for the children at a school in the area. She has been doing this work for the past 3 years. She needs the loan to purchase pots and utensils to continue preparing food. Her dream is to continue with this business which is what she knows how to do best and provide a good education for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy pots and utensils to continue preparing food.

loans.name: Graciela Del Pilar

texts.es: Graciela, es una mujer de 34 años de edad, soltera, dinámica y trabajadora, tiene dos hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos crudos en un local del mercado. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar más pollos para la venta y llegar a más clientes. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio y que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en: Graciela, 34, is a dynamic, hard-working woman with two children, 11- and 8-years old, respectively.  She makes a living buying and selling whole, uncooked chickens.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy more chickens that she will then resell.  The investment will help her attract new customers and grow her business.  For the future, Graciela wants to open a shop of her own and see her children train up for paid careers.

loans.use: to buy whole chickens for her retail business.

loans.name: Jenny Magaly

texts.es: Jenny, es una mujer de 37 años de edad, viuda, tiene 4 hijas de 18, 16, 13 y 4 años, de las cuales una ya es casada  y las demás asisten al colegio y escuela. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cobijas desde ya hace 6 años atrás, especialmente los días de feria en la ciudad de Tulcán. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para poder venderla. Su sueño es ponerse un local propio para brindarles la educación que sus hijas se merecen.
texts.en: Jenny is a 37 year old woman. She is a widow and has 4 daughters, who are 18, 16, 13 and 4 years old. One of them is already married and the others attend high school and primary school. She works selling clothes and blankets, which she has done for 6 years already, specially on market days in the city of Tulcan. She needs the loan to buy merchandise that she can sell. Her dream is to open her own store so that she can give her daughters the education they deserve.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that she can sell

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es: Gloria, de 27 años con un niño menor de edad, es una mujer que se caracteriza por su tenacidad y empuje, debido a la difícil situación económica y por desempleo de su pareja, se vio en la necesidad de emprender algo que le brindara ingresos de forma independiente, hace cuatro años empezó a vender comidas y fritos en la casa de sus suegros. Gloria sueña con tener un negocio más amplio y reconocido, colocar un segundo negocio en la casa de su madre, Solicitó este crédito con el fin de mejorar el negocio y comprar insumos e implementos para la elaboración de dichos productos.  Brindar a sus clientes un servicio activo y de mucha calidad.
texts.en: Gloria is 27 years old and has a minor-aged boy. She is a woman characterized by her tenacity and drive. Due to her partner's unemployment and their difficult economic situation, she saw a need to undertake something that could provide an independent source of income. Four years ago she began selling fried food and other food at her in-laws' house. Gloria dreams of having a larger and better-recognized business and installing a second business at her mother's house. She requested this loan with the intention of improving the business and buying supplies and tools for the preparation of her products. She offers high quality and energetic customer service.

loans.use: to improve her business and to purchase supplies and tools for food preparation.

loans.name: Lina María

texts.es: Lina es una mujer emprendedora dedicada a la elaboración y venta de artesanías (mariposas en acetato, muñecos de tela y espuma, pinturas en óleo, porta retratos en madera), entre otros. Adicionalmente se desempeña como gerontóloga de manera independiente y participa en diversos grupos de apoyo del municipio donde vive. Ella piensa invertir el crédito en diversos materiales para su negocio (acetatos, tela, espuma, pinturas) y mejorar sus ingresos, de manera que pueda pagar la universidad de su hijo, porque sueña con que él continúe sus estudios y se convierta en un gran profesional.
texts.en: Lina is an enterprising woman who makes a living making and selling handicrafts (acetate butterlies, fabric and foam dolls, oil paintings, and wooden picture frames) among others. She also works as a self-employed gerontologist and takes part in various support groups in the town where she lives. She is planning on investing the loan in various materials for her business (acetates, fabric, foam and paint) in boost her earnings, so that she can pay for her son to attend university, because she dreams of him continuing with his studies and becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business (acetates, fabric, foam and paint)

loans.name: Fatima Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, es una mujer de 24 años de edad, es casada, tiene una hija de 1 año de edad, se dedica a confeccionar ropa desde hace 4 años atrás, especialmente ropa interior para caballeros. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales como hilos, elásticos. Su sueño es tener su negocio propio para posteriormente darle una buena educación a su hija cuando crezca.
texts.en: Carmen is a 24 year old woman. She is married and has a 1 year old daughter. For four years she has worked sewing clothes, specially men underwear.  She needs the loan to buy material such as threads and elastic band. Her dream is to have her own business so that she can give her daughter a good education when she is grows up.

loans.use: to buy materials such as threads, elastic band.

loans.name: Muminahan

texts.ru: Муминахан 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старшая дочь-замужем, младшие дети учатся в школе. У Муминахан - среднее образование, она трудолюбивая, честная и целеустремленная.  В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Муминахан занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад с 2,000 сомов (KGS). Муминахан на сегодняшний день имеет 1 дойную корову, также  0,30 ГА земельной доли, на которой занимается земледелием. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Муминахан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупки минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов, семян картошки и хлопка. Также купит коров для откорма и дальнейшей реализации. Муминахан намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Муминахан планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Muminahan is 41 and married with three children. Her oldest daughter is married and the younger children are in school. Muminahan has a high school education and is a hard-working, honest and purposeful woman who works in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 25 years ago with 2,000 KGS. Now she has one milking cow and 0.3 hectares of arable land, on which she grows crops, with a monthly income of about 10,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Muminahan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers, pesticides, seed potatoes and cotton seeds. She will also buy cattle for fattening and resale. Muminahan intends to have a good harvest, which will improve her family's financial situation. She plans to use profits from the loan into further increasing the number of livestock she owns and to save toward building a cattle shed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and cattle

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor adulto de 48 años, vive con su compañera y dos hijos menores de edad, trabaja como guarda de líneas telefónicas en una zona cerca al departamento donde reside, por el tiempo que le queda Víctor inicia vendiendo mercancías poco a poco, y actualmente se ha visto el incremento de las ventas, generando más ganancias. Sueña con dar una mejor educación a sus hijos menores y que su nivel de vida cada vez sea mayor. Con el crédito solicitado surtirá de gran variedad, como ropa de dama, niños, caballeros,  para ofrecer a los clientes fieles que ha ido teniendo  a lo largo de este negocio una variedad al mejor costo.
texts.en: Víctor, ia a 48 year old man. He lives with his domestic partner and two minor children. He works as a security guard of telephone lines in an area close to the apartment where he lives. In his free time Victor has started selling merchandise little by little. Currently he has seen an increase in sales, generating more earnings. He dreams of giving his young children a better education and that their quality of life improves. With the requested loan he will stock with more diverse items such as clothes for women, children and men, so that he can offer his business' loyal customers more variety at the best price.

loans.use: to stock with more diverse items such as clothes for women, children, men

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get a number of pigs and the supplies to feed and vaccinate them.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco de 57 años es casado y tienen dos hijos, después de haber terminado su labores en una empresa reconocida de la ciudad, y como es una persona muy activa decidió empezar un negocio de salsamentaría en el barrio donde reside, allí atiende toda la semana y le apoya en esto otra persona, haciendo diferente turno, el sueño de Francisco es tener una estabilidad económica y disfrutar de su familia en compañía con sus nietos, por el momento solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar surtido (granos, sal, café, galletería) y tener variedad de productos para su fiel clientela, seguir posesionado en el lugar de trabajo y disfrutar de lo que le gusta.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 57, is married and has two children.  Having finished his career in a company that is well-known in the city, and as he is a very active person, he decided to start a deli in the neighborhood where he lives.  He works there all week; another person helps him working different shifts.  

Francisco’s dream is to have financial stability and to enjoy his family in the company of his grandchildren.  Right now he is asking for a loan for the purpose of buying merchandise (basic staples, salt, coffee, cookies) and having a variety of products for his faithful customers.  He can keep owning his business and enjoying what he likes.

loans.use: to buy salt, coffee, and cookies for the deli he started

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura vive con sus padres y hermanos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas que trae de Foz de yguazu, viaja dos veces al mes, se va a la facultad de noche, y comenta que está estudiando la carrera de fisioterapia, ya que siempre quiso poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Sus metas futuras son trabajar en la profesión que está estudiando y también poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder seguir pagando su cuota de la universidad, estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Laura lives with her parents and siblings. She works selling used clothing that she brings from Foz de Yguazu. She travels twice a month. She goes to school at night. She says that she is studying physical therapy since she has always wanted to be able to help other people.

Her future goals are to work in the profession she is studying and to be able to help her family.

She is asking for this loan to be able to continue paying her university tuition fees, studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old, married, and has six children who attend school.  She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years. 

Gina requested her ninth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Iladier

texts.es: Iladier es un joven campesino de 23 años,  vive en una vereda en las afueras de otro departamento del país, trabaja en una finca, hace varios años y el propietario le brindó la oportunidad de que utilizará parte de la tierra de esta finca para la cría de gallinas ponedoras, un negocio muy rentable por la gran demanda que tiene este producto en todos los sectores a nivel nacional, Iladier sueña con tener un gran número de estas gallinas ponedoras, solicitó el crédito con el fin  de invertir en los animales y comprar cuido para el sostenimiento del mismo, ya tiene muchos pedidos pendientes de entregar,  haciendo que su economía se incremente cada vez más, lo cual capitalizará para que en un futuro tenga el nivel de vida que anhela.
texts.en:
Iladier is a young farmer aged 23. He lives in a hamlet on the border of another department in the country. He has worked on a farm for several years and the owner has given him the chance to use part of the land on this farm to rear laying hens. This is a very profitable business due to the high demand for this product in all sectors on a national level. 

Iladier dreams of having a large number of these laying hens. He requested the loan with the aim of investing in the animals and buying everything he needs to look after them. He already has a lot of orders waiting to be delivered, meaning that his finances keep increasing, which he will capitalize on so that in the future he has the living standard he wants.
