loans.use: to buy laying hens and feed.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: Mary es madre soltera de 30 años, tiene dos hijos  menores de edad, mujer muy emprendedora, responsable y capaz de salir adelante, su proyecto actual es iniciar con una papelería en el parque principal del municipio donde habita junto con sus hijos, Sueña con tener un negocio muy amplio y bonito para que sea agradable y tenga la aceptación del público, Mary pasó la solitud del crédito con el fin de pagar el arriendo del local que ya tiene separado y con el saldo comprar buena cantidad de surtido (cuadernos, colores, cartulinas, reglas, etc) en fin todo lo relacionado con esta actividad, las ganancias de sus ventas serán muy bien invertidas en la educación de sus niñas, ya que no cuenta fácilmente con el apoyo de su familia. Asi podrá mejorar su nivel de vida y el de sus niñas.
texts.en:
Mary is a single mother, age 30.  She has two children, who are minors.  She is a very enterprising and responsible woman, capable of getting ahead.  

Her current project is to begin an office supply store on the main park of the city where she lives together with her children.  She dreams of having a very large, attractive business that would be nice and popular.    

Mary submitted her loan application with the goal of paying the rent on the shop that she has already set aside, and with the rest she will buy a good supply of merchandise (notebooks, crayones, poster board, rulers, etc.); everything related to this business, in short.  She will invest the earnings from her sales her daughters’ education, because she can’t assume she has the support of her family.  In this way, she can improve her quality of life and that of her daughters.

loans.use: to buy a good quantity of merchandise (notebooks, crayones, poster board, rulers, etc.)

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is 39 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband does work in a small firm for very low daily wages and comes home very late at night. She has to pick up and drop off her children herself, manage routine work, and complete her tasks for embroidery. She has been knitting embroidery for many years.

Shamshad requested a loan, which she will use to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors for embroidery work at home.  Her dream is to construct her house for her children, so she is saving money. With the loan, she plans to increase her monthly income and savings.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Gloria Stella

texts.es: Gloria es una mujer viuda de 54 años, que vive en zona rural  y desde muy joven aprendió la cría de cerdos y el engorde de pollos junto a su familia, esta actividad la continua ejerciendo hasta el presente, su sueño es poder tener muchos animales para la crianza, con el préstamo ella comprará pollos y cerdos además de todos los insumos y alimentos que necesita para el cuidado de estos, la venta en cantidad representan para Gloria muchos ingresos mejorando para ella su nivel de vida y su familia.
texts.en: Gloria is a widow aged 54, who lives in a rural area. From a very young age, she learned how to raise pigs and fatten chickens with her family, and she has continued to carry out this activity up to today. Her dream is to have a lot of animals to raise. Will the loan, she will buy chickens and pigs along with all the food and inputs they need to look after them. Selling in volume represents high earnings for Gloria which would improve her and her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs along with all the food and inputs they need.

loans.name: Laura Elisa

texts.es: Laura, es una mujer de 47 años de edad, soltera, amable  y trabajadora, tiene una hija de 20 años que vive con ella. Ella se dedica al cultivo de mora desde hace 3 años atrás, sus cultivos lo tiene ubicados en la parroquia de Maldonado, su hija le ayuda en los cultivos, los fines de semana porque ella asiste a la Universidad. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar fungicidas para cuidar los cultivos. Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo para seguir siempre para adelante.
texts.en:
Laura is 47 years old and single.  She is friendly and hard-working.  She has a 20 year old daughter who lives with her.

She has been growing blackberries for three years.  Her crops are located in the Maldonado parish.  Her daughter helps her with the crops on the week-ends because she goes to the university.

She needs the loan to buy fungicides to care for the crops.  Her dream is for her business to continue growing in order to always get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fungicides to care for the crops.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is married and has seven children who attend school. For the past four years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. 

Mbeyu requested a loan from Yehu, which she will use to purchase cooking oil, sweets, groundnuts, and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Mbeyu owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sweets, groundnuts, and sugar

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la siembra de maíz y maicillo adicional a eso también trabaja como jornal en una finca cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Carlos esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, controles de plagas,  herbicidas, etc.  y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 55  years old and lives in his own home with his son. For many years, he has made a living by growing corn and sorghum. Additionally, he works as a laborer at a farm near his home. With the money he earns from his jobs, he is able to cover some household expenses.

Carlos requests a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase agricultural supplies like fertilizers, seeds, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc. and improve the land, which is shown in the photograph. This will help him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc., and improve the land.

loans.name: Thoem's Group

texts.en:
Thoem is 61 years old, married, and has eight children. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 35 years. She earns about 20,000 KHR a day to meet her family’s needs.

Thoerm is the leader of Thoem's Group. She requested her fourth loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She completely repaid the prior loans, which have helped her better support her family.  She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Eleuterio viene de una familia humilde, está trabajando en una empresa y sus padres tienen una despensa en su casa, donde el también ayuda.
Él está estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas, y su aspiración es terminar  su carrera y ejercer su profesión  en la empresa que trabaja y lograr un ascenso de su puesto.
Pide de este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Eleuterio comes from a humble family. He works in an enterprise and his parents have a store in their home where he also helps out.

He is studying for a career in business administration and he aspires to finish his degree and practice his profession in the enterprise where he works. Also, he hopes to advance in his future post.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his university fees and, also, to be able to cover his transportation costs.

Eleuterio is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to cover university fees and the cost of transportation.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a cow-raising business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase an additional cow to raise.

Rosalinda has been in this business for seven years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow to raise.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim is 32 years old and has three children. She is a resident of a rural village of the Moung Russey district. The main source of her family’s income is rice farming, which she has been doing for 14 years. With her current business, she earns about 25,000 KHR a day to spend for daily expenses.
 
Sim is the leader of Sim's Group. She requested her third loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She successfully repaid her prior loans. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 1,800 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp. 

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night. Violeta is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Elena, tiene 37 años de edad, casada tiene 4 hijos 2 niños de 16 y 14 años y dos niñas de 11 y 2 años de edad, de los cuales los tres primeros van al colegio y a la escuela. Ella se dedica a la confección y arreglar prendas de vestir. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales como hilos, elásticos, botones entre otros. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y educar  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena is 37 years old. She is married and has 4 children: two boys, ages 16 and 14, and two girls, ages 11 and 2. The three oldest attend school. 

She makes a living by making and repairing articles of clothing. She needs this loan to purchase materials like thread, elastic, buttons, etc.

Her dream is to have her own home and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials like thread, elastic, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto-rickshaw for the last many years. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So, he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

Kishwar's husband wants to buy a new auto-rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Kishwar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Kishwar is so thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy her husband a new auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 60 years old and married, with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fertilizer and to pay for laborers' salaries.

Lilia has been farming sugarcane for 30 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and to pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Rosemlin

texts.en:
Rosemlin is 37 years old and married, with three children.

She earns a living by raising cows in the Philippines. Rosemlin is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her cow.

Rosemlin has been raising cows for nine years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cow.

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es: Rosa, es una mujer de 37 años de edad, amable y trabajadora, casada, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellas son independientes y su hijo de 7 años que va a la escuela. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo desde ya 3 años atrás. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa y seguir manteniendo su negocio. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y tener su negocio en marcha para mantener a su hijo hasta que acabe sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 37-year-old woman who is friendly and hardworking. She has three children, two of whom are adults. Her 7-year-old son attends school.

For the past three years, she has sold clothing from catalogs. She needs this loan to purchase clothing and continue to maintain her business.

Her dream is to own her own home and keep her business functioning so that she can support her son until he finishes school.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and continue to maintain her business.

loans.name: Iván Alberto

texts.es: Iván de 32 años, vive con su compañera y tienen dos hijos menores de edad, es un hombre muy luchador e incansable, labora en una ladrillera de 2 am hasta las 9 am, luego particularmente se va a cargar  camiones con mercancía hasta las 3pm, y el tiempo restante lo utiliza en una finca de unos familiares donde le han permitido sembrar caña de azúcar, café y también criar cerdos, negocio que alterna con las demás actividades, Iván sueña con tener los cerdos en su propia vivienda y para ello necesita construir los corrales, por este motivo solicitó dicho crédito para construir los corrales y comprar más cerdos, invertir en los insumos que se necesitan para  la cría y poder de esta manera ofrecer animales de buena calidad y a  mejor precio, obteniendo grandes beneficios que van en pro del bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Iván is 32 years old. He lives with his companion, and they have two minor children. He is a very hard-working and tireless man. 

He works in a brick factory from 2 am to 9 am, then he goes to load trucks with merchandise until 3 pm, and he uses the remaining time on the farm of some relatives, where they have allowed him to plant sugar cane and coffee and also to raise pigs, a business that he alternates with his other activities. 

Iván dreams of having the pigs at his own house, and to do that, he needs to build the pens. For this reason, he has applied for this loan to build the pens and buy more pigs, invest in the supplies needed to raise them, and be able to offer animals of good quality at a better price, obtaining a large return for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to invest in a pig-raising venture (building pens, buying pigs, etc)

loans.name: Jhonny Ferney

texts.es: Jhonny, es un hombre de 38 años de edad, soltero, es emprendedor, alegre y muy dinámico, tiene 3 hijos de 4, 15 y 8 años de edad quienes viven con su madre. Desde hace mas de 10 años se dedica al negocio de la confección, el confecciona y distribuye ropa interior para caballeros, en casi todo el Ecuador donde tiene sus clientes. El necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para la confección como telas, hilos y elásticos. Su sueño es tener su propia marca de ropa interior para caballeros y además velar por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en: Jhonny is a man of 38. He is single. He is a happy and very dynamic entrepreneur. He has three children, ages 4, 15, and 8, who live with their mother. He has had a sewing business for more than 10 years. He makes and distributes men's underwear in almost all of Ecuador, where he has customers. He needs the loan to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, thread, and elastic. His dream is to have his own brand of men's underwear and, in addition, to watch over the well-being of his children.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, thread, and elastic

loans.name: Marta Lucia

texts.es: Marta, es una mujer de 36 años de edad, soltera, es emprendedora, alegre e inquieta, tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 5 años de edad que asisten al colegio y escuela. Ella desde hace 8 años atrás se dedica a la estampación de prendas de vestir. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales de estampado como bastidores y pintura de serigrafía para seguir estampando. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y que su negocio se encuentre bien consolidado, además que quiere que sus hijos sean unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en: Marta is a woman of 36. She is single and is a happy, eager entrepreneur. She has two children, ages 15 and 5, who are in school. For eight years, she has been screen-printing articles of clothing. She needs the loan to buy printing materials such as frames and screen-printing paint to continue printing. Her dream is to have her own house and a well-established business. In addition, she hopes that her children will have good professionals careers.

loans.use: to buy printing materials such as frames and screen-printing paint to continue printing.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with eight school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, Margaret has been selling goat meat at the market to the general public. The main challenge to her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es soltera, vive con su mama y papa en su casa propia, tiene 2 hermanos. Ella está estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas, su meta es poder terminar su carrera y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo. Ella está luchando y procurando por mejorar su vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando y luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Claudia is single, lives with her mother and father in their home, and has two siblings. She is studying Business Administration. Her goal is to finish her degree and be able to help her loved ones with her job. She is fighting to improve her life.

She requests this loan so that she will be able to pay the university fees and expenses related to her degree. This way, she will be able to continue studying and fighting as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees and expenses.

loans.name: Melagros

texts.en:
Melagros is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. She earns additional income from farming corn and sugar cane and selling fish.

Melagros requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married with five school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Chizi has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старший сын учится в школе, младшие дошкольного возраста. Все члены семьи активно помогают по хозяйству. Супруг также предоставляет услуги по обработке земли. У Гульмиры- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульмира занимается животноводством и полеводством , стартовав в 1997 году, с 10,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гульмира на сегодняшний день имеет 3 дойные коровы, 10 овец, также  занимается продажей молока.  Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для покупки коровы и часть кредита пустить на весенне-полевые работы. Доходы от кредита Гульмира хочет вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, сбор хорошего урожая и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее образование сыновей.
texts.en: Gulmira is 36 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising three children. Her oldest son attends school, her younger sons are still toddlers. All of the members of her family actively help her with her farming. Her husband also offers services tilling land. Gulmira has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Gulmira practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business in 1997 with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulmira's hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows and 10 sheep on her farm. She also sells milk from the cows. Her monthly cumulative income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulmira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows and a portion of the loan will be used for spring sowing work. Gulmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock and to get a good harvest. She also intends to save money for her for her sons' future education.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Ajat

texts.en:
Ajat lives west of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Ajat is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Ajat began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Armando Marcelo

texts.es: Armando, es un hombre de 48 años, soltero, extrovertido y responsable. El es taxista desde ya 10 años atrás. El necesita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su taxi como llantas y accesorios. Su sueño es poder comprarse un camión para transportar mercaderías.
texts.en:
Armando, who is 48 years old, is single, extroverted, and responsible. For the past 10 years, he has worked as a taxi driver.

He needs this loan to purchase parts for his taxi, like tires and accessories. His dream is to be able to purchase a truck to transport merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase parts for his taxi, like tires and accessories.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling purified water in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of purified water to sell for her business.

Felisa has been in this business for 27 years. She earns more income from food vending and a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of purified water to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 58-years-old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Marcelina has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jenabudha Group

texts.en:
Pushpanjali, 47 years old, is a married woman who lives in a remote village called Sripali near the M. Rampur block of Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. The lady standing in the front row, second from left with her hand raised is Pushpanjali.  She lives with her husband. She is very energetic, hard working and enthusiastic and always devotes her time to getting her family ahead. 

At present, she is running a tailoring shop in her locality very successfully. Her husband is also supporting her in his leisure time. Her husband is a mason to earn his livelihood. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income through her own efforts. At present, her family income is about Rs 6, 500 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. During 2014, along with 11 other members of her locality, Pushpanjali formed a group.
It is the first time the group will take a loan from MSF. With the loan, Pushpanjali will purchase a sewing machine, a Pico machine and some thread to add to her business.
  
The other members of her group are doing a milk business, vegetable vending, a grocery shop, a hotel, a salon, a bookstore, a fancy shop, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, a Pico machine and some thread

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ella está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, es una mujer que está luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Le gustaría poder terminar la carrera y potenciar su empresa, también quiere ser una profesional exitosa y formar un día una familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, ya que está necesitando y quiere cubrir ese gasto. Agradece por esta ayuda que recibe.
texts.en:
Liliana is from the city of San Ignacio. She is studying in the Business Administration program. She is a woman who is working to be able to improve her living conditions.

She would like to be able to finish her program and advance her business. She also wants to be a successful professional and someday have a family.

She is applying for this loan to be able to pay her university bills, since she needs and wants to cover this expense. She is grateful to receive this help.

loans.use: to pay university bills

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 31-years-old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Rebecca has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for two years. Marilyn earns more income from a general store.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  Amalia requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, sugar, shampoo, eggs, coffee, etc.

She has been in this business for six years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Amalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Philemena

texts.en:
Philemena is married with seven school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Philemena has operated a clothes selling business for the past five years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 39 years old and married, with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mirasol has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell, like pants, blouses, and shorts.

Mirasol has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell, like pants, blouses, and shorts.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman who has been blessed with four children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Nancy has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Carmelita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, diapers, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as canned goods, eggs, spices, diapers, etc.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a businesswoman who is very hard-working.She is married, with four school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Hadija has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan, Hadija wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Arely

texts.es: Arely de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella tiene un negocio de venta de licuados y jugos ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logra salir adelante, Arely esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  frutas por mayor, leche, jugos, azúcar, etc. y asi seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Arely is 45 years old and lives in her own home alongside her husband and three children. She has her own business where she sells shakes and juices. It is located in her home, in a high traffic area. With the earnings she makes, and with the help of her husband she has been able to get ahead. Arley is asking for a loan to purchase wholesale fruits, milk, juices, sugar etc. and to be able to continue working in her business and to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase wholesale fruit, milk, juices, sugar etc.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines.

Edelyn requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Edelyn has been in this business for six years now.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Edelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
This is Kache - a very hardworking and enterprising woman who appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

Besides the business selling livestock, Kache operates a green grocery business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Nora Emilsen

texts.es: Nora es una mujer empresaria a la que le gusta disfrutar del éxito, desde hace dos años inició con la venta y distribución de productos de aseo y belleza de una marca muy reconocida a nivel mundial, junto con su hermana,  Sueña con tener un gran equipo de trabajo y ampliar las zonas de venta y reparto de estos productos los cuales tienen muy buena acogida, el  préstamo lo invertirá en un amplio stock para tener una reserva y poder ofrecer con tiempo a sus clientas en el momento que lo pidan, las ventas al por mayor le dan a Nora unas ganancias muy altas lo que le ha permitido disfrutar su vida cada día con mucho entusiasmo.
texts.en:
Nora is a woman entrepreneur who likes to enjoy success. Two years ago she started with the sale and distribution of toiletries and beauty products from a globally recognized brand, together with her sister. 

She dreams of having a bigger team and growing the sales and delivery of these products, which are very well received. She will invest the loan in a large stock to have a reserve and be able to offer them to her clients in a timely fashion upon request. The wholesale sales gives Nora the high returns that have allowed her to enjoy her life each day with enthusiasm.

loans.use: to buy her product, beauty supplies, in order to grow her business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Nelson está  solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL  para comprar insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir haciendo su siembra y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nelson is 39 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He is in agriculture for a living and has been for some years. His main crops are corn and beans. He sells his products in different markets that are near his home. Nelson is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy agricultural inputs like: fertilizer, herbicide, pest control, seeds, etc and to improve his land that is in the photograph shown in order to continue with his crops and be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pest control, seeds etc. and to improve the soil.

loans.name: Astrid

texts.es:
Astrid una persona que se sacrifica por lo que quiere, le ha costado mucho sobrellevar sus estudios y su trabajo al mismo tiempo. Además ella comenta que tiene un hijo, pero gracias al apoyo de su familia está saliendo adelante.
Su mayor inspiración es su hijo y su familia porque quiere lo mejor para ellos. Ella esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y con ello quiere poder Salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Astrid makes sacrifices to achieve the things she wants. It has been a real challenge for her to continue studying and keep her job at the same time. She says that she also has a son, but that thanks to her family's support, she is making great strides in life.
Her son and her family are her greatest inspiration because she wants the best for all of them. She is studying business administration and hopes it will help her get ahead in life.
She is requesting this loan to pay her graduation costs so that she can keep studying.

loans.use: to pay her graduation costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay graduation costs.

loans.name: Delma

texts.es:
Delma es del Chaco, está viviendo con su mama y sus dos hermanos. Está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, ya que quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas con su trabajo.
Ella está queriendo terminar la facultad para así llegar a ser una Licenciada en Enfermería y tener su propio ingreso y también ayudar a su familia. Para luego de a poco ir independizándose y llegar a ser alguien en la vida como toda persona quiere.   
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, ya que así podrá seguir luchando por cumplir su meta.
texts.en:
Delma is from the Chaco region. She lives with her mother and her two siblings. She is studying nursing and wants to be able to help others through her work.
She is hoping to finish school and receive her diploma in nursing so she can earn her own income and help support her family. After that, she will eventually move out and really be somebody in life, just as everyone hopes to.   
She is requesting this loan to pay her graduation costs so that she can keep working toward her goal.

loans.use: to pay her graduation costs.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana es una joven de 20 años, es creativa y emprendedora, desde hace dos años firmó contrato con una empresa multinacional para vender y distribuir una gran variedad de productos de aseo y belleza, tuvo varios inconvenientes por las ventas que no habían alcanzado metas, pero en la actualidad su grupo ha crecido representativamente,  Juliana sueña con terminar la Universidad y también ser una gran vendedora que pueda escalar en lo profesional, solicita el crédito para adquirir mercancía, teniendo un stock amplio para suplir los pedidos sobre todo en las temporadas importantes, con lo que ganaría más dinero, sosteniendo su estudio para terminarlo a cabalidad.
texts.en: Juliana is a 20 year-old youth. She is creative and entrepreneurial. She signed a contract two years ago with a multinational corporation to sell and distribute a great variety of toiletries and beauty products. She had various challenges such that she didn't meet her sales goals, but today her group representation has grown. Juliana dreams of finishing University and also being a great salesperson that can rise in her profession. She is requesting a loan to acquire merchandise, having a large stock to meet requests most importantly in the busy season, with which she will could earn more money, enabling her to finish her studies fully.

loans.use: to buy toiletries and beauty products.

loans.name: Danelyn

texts.en:
Danelyn is 32 years old, married, and has one child.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Danelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Danelyn has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Danelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a lumber yard business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and sell-charcoal. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks of wood to sell for her lumber yard business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of wood to sell.

loans.name: Gerber Antonio

texts.es: Gerber vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, él se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, Gerber está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Gerber lives in his own house with his family group. He is in agriculture for a living. His main crops are corn and beans. He sells his products in the surrounding area. Gerber is requesting a loan to be able to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicide, seeds, etc. and to improve the soil that is shown in the photo. In this way he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicide, seeds, etc and to improve the soil.

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado Ñepytyvo, es de la ciudad de Lambaré, inician el primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Son 20 mujeres que están poniendo todo su esfuerzo para poder mejorar su vida por medio del trabajo unido de ellas.
Catalina es una de ellas, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida, comenta que al principio le fue un poco difícil empezar, pero poco a poco se fue abriendo camino y hoy día ya tienen muy buena clientela. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad de crecimiento que está recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda, y con lo cual podrá seguir dando a sus seres queridos todo lo que no pudieron tener.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, enlatados, panificados y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas, y de esa forma poder seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que piden.
texts.en:
The Ñepytyvo village bank, in the city of Lambaré, is in its first loan cycle with the women's committee program. It is made up of 20 women who are giving it their all to try to improve their lives through their combined efforts.
Catalina is one of these women. She has a well-stocked little grocery store and says that she had a hard time getting started at first but that the way gradually opened to her and today she has a very reliable customer base. She is grateful for this opportunity to grow that she is being given, which will be a great help to her and allow her to continue to offer her loved ones everything they have not been able to have in the past.
She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables, meat, canned goods, baked goods, and other products to sell so that she can keep offering her customers everything they want.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, canned goods, baked goods, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Ruben de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. El se dedica  a la venta de frutas lo hace de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, su esposa le ayuda con el negocio. Ruben  solicita un préstamo para poder comprar papayas, guineos, piñas, etc. por mayor ya que de esta manera el podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Ruben is 51 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He is a very hardworking person, who fully devotes himself to his business, with the sole desire to succeed and thus provide a better life for his family. He is a street vendor, selling fruits in different markets that are near his residence. His wife helps him with the business. Ruben is requesting a loan to buy papayas, bananas, pineapples, etc.. wholesale so that he will be able to sell more, which is his priority, as it will enable him to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy papayas, bananas, pineapples, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Mohigul

texts.ru: Мохигул 35 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Мохигул среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мохигул занимается животноводством и полеводством. Стартовав 12 лет назад с 5,000 сомов (KGS), ее трудолюбие и упорство позволили развить свой бизнес до ежемесячной прибыли в размере 10,000 сомов (KGS). Мохигул имеет земельный надел, размером 0,10 ГА, на котором она и планирует заниматься полеводством, а именно выращивать картофель для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мохигул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку семян картофеля элитного сорта, минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов для посевных работ. Доходы от кредита Мохигул планирует вложить в развитие своего бизнеса и накопить средства на покупку легкового автомобиля.
texts.en: Mohigul is 35 years old, married, and a mother to two children. Mohigul has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Mohigul practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 12 years ago with 5,000 som (KGS). Her hard work and perseverance allowed her to develop her business so that she makes a monthly profit of 10,000 som (KGS). Mohigul has a 0.10 hectare plot of land on which she plans to do crop farming, specifically growing potatoes for personal consumption and sale. For the purpose of further developing her business, Mohigul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy high quality potato seeds, mineral fertilizers and chemical pesticides for the sowing season. Mohigul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the development of her business. She also intends to save money to buy car.

loans.use: to buy high quality potato seeds, mineral fertilizers and chemical pesticides for the sowing season.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Eleonor works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell eggs. Eleonor is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell through her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Eleonor has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Mehrinisso

texts.ru: Ей 50 лет. Ее зовут  Мехриниссо. Она замужем и в браке у нее есть трое детей. 19 летний сын и двое дочки. Мехриниссо счастлива в браке, и любит свою семью. Ее муж любит животных занимается выращиванием скотин дома для того, чтобы обеспечить семью мясом и молоком. Мехриниссо тоже умеет ухаживать, кормить и поить скотин. Свои навыки и умения Мехриниссо решила выложить в новый бизнес в сфере животноводства. У нее имеется коровник и корм. Некоторое время назад, Мехриниссо занималась разведению скотин, но когда выдала своих дочерей замуж, она продала всех скотин, чтобы сыграть свадьбу и купить им приданное. Мехриниссо решила возобновить бизнес, и восстановить источник дохода. Помогите Мехриниссо осуществить задуманное.
texts.en: This is Mehrinisso. She is 50 years old. She is married and has three children from her marriage - a 19-year-old son and two daughters. Mehrinisso is happy in her marriage and loves her family. Her husband loves animals and raises cattle at home in order to provide his family with meat and milk. Mehrinisso is also able to look after, feed and water the cattle. Mehrinisso decided to invest her skills and knowledge  in a new business in the sphere of livestock breeding. She has a cow shed and cattle feed. Some time ago, Mehrinisso raised cattle, but when her daughters got married, she sold all of her cattle in order throw their weddings and buy their dowries. Mehrinisso decided to restart her business and regain a source of income. Please help Mehrinisso fulfill her goal.

loans.use: to buy cattle to restart her business and regain a source of income.

loans.name: Villa Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Villa del sol es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Asunción, es un grupo que está trabajando por luchar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirtha, quien cuenta que hace empanadas y asaditos todas las noches, también se debe destacar el trabajo que ella está haciendo, ya que lucha por su familia para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Mirtha está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus ingredientes para la venta de comestibles,  como carne, condimentos, panificados y demás, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, y así a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Villa del sol is a group formed in Asunción that is working to fight for and to improve its members’ living conditions.

One of the members is Mrs. Mirtha, who makes empanadas and barbecue every night. The work she is doing should also be highlighted: she struggles for her family to give them the things that she couldn’t have. Mirtha is trying her best to keep improving their living conditions.

Mrs. Mirtha is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for the sale of groceries such as meat, spices, bread among other things, which would help her establish her business plan, and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, breads, and more

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Eugenio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, controles de plagas,  herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía, y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Eugenio is 45 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He is in agriculture for a living. He grows corn and beans. He sells them in different markets that are near his home. Eugenio is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, manure, pest control, herbicide and to improve the soil that is shown in the photo. In this way he can obtain better income to give his family what they need without a limitation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, manure, pest control, herbicide and to improve the soil.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda works hard to support her family. Gilda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gilda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like cereals, chocolate drinks, eggs, bread, etc. to sell.

Gilda has been in this business for five years now.

Gilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like cereals, chocolate drinks, eggs, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Theara

texts.en: Theara (in photo) is 40 years old, lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, and has two daughters. Both daughters are in school. Theara is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. But, the motorbike is old and does not work well. Facing this, Theara decided to apply for a loan buy a new motorcycle for her husband.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her husband's business.

loans.name: Srors

texts.en:
Srors (in photo) is a garment factory worker. Her husband produces jars at his home and transports them to sell in the nearby village and other provinces. She has two children, one son and one daughter. 

Srors wants to buy a cow to raise. She will earn extra income from selling the cow when it’s fully grown. Hoping this, she decided to apply for a loan buy a cow to raise.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра всегда старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Ей 41 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Гулчехра решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. Она начала свой бизнес шитьём женской одежды 4 месяца назад. Она хочет развевать свой новый бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки вышивальной машинки, чтобы развевать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulchehra is always trying to improve her living conditions and stimulate the economic status of her family. She is 41 years old. She is married and is raising two children. Her husband receives a small salary. This salary is not enough to provide the family with all of the necessities. Gulchehra decided to help her husband for the benefit of their family. She started her own business of sewing women's clothing four months ago. She wants to develop her new business. With this goal, she took part in the course "Achieve Success" organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy an embroidery machine to develop her new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine to organize her new business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 42 years old and married with four children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Yolanda has borrowed and repaid twenty-nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Yolanda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items like soap, toothpaste, shampoo, eggs, chips, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Eleonor has been in this business for 20 years. Eleonor earns additional income from a buy and sell fish business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soap, toothpaste, shampoo, eggs, chips, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with seven children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers in her business. Cristina has been in this business for 25 years. Cristina earns additional income from selling souvenir items.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun (in photo), age 52, lives in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh city. She has five children, three sons and two daughters. One of her children is married, two are garment factory workers, and the other two attend school. 

Savoeun stays at home and does house work. The main source of income is from her husband and children’s salary. Her husband work for Cambodian Mine Action Center (CMAC). 

She is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children who are garment factory workers to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: 36 Phú Vượng Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Diệu operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Diệu is 59 years old and she is married with 8 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 36 Phú Vượng Hưng Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2010, Diệu  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Diệu has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Diệu  has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Diệu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Diệu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Annabelita

texts.en:
Annabelita has been operating her buy-and-sell cosmetics products business for more than ten years, and she earns well from this. Her husband works abroad, and she had to sustain her business for their emergency needs. 

Being far from her husband makes her aware of being prepared. The couple has to work hard with determination to have a better income to provide their children with a better education. 

She took a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to cover the cost of house renovation. 

In the future, Annabelita hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of house renovation.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a PUJ (Public Utility Jeepney) driver. He is 43 years old and married, and he has five children. His wife is a housewife and doesn't work on incoming business. They are living in Zamboanga City.

Edgar has been in this business for more than five years. The jeep is seen in this picture. Today, he needs a loan to cover jeep repair and maintenance costs. Edgar is greatly thankful to the GDMPC for their help. He wants to improve the general living situation of his family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover jeep repair and maintenance costs

loans.name: Liễu

texts.en:
Liễu is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Liễu operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish sauce. 

In 2011, Liễu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liễu has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liễu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Liễu faces in her life is not having clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy brick, cement, and sand to build a toilet.

In the future, Liễu hopes for her children to find a good job, to build a new house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a toilet

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Fe is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Carmela works hard to support her family.

She has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water and food vending. Carmela is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for her vehicle.

Carmela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for her vehicle.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 45 years old and married with four children.

Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Elsa has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from selling natural medicines.

Elsa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is 53 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Delfina runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, and noodles. 

She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, and noodles to sell.

In the future, Delfina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with five children who attend school which is the reason of her hard work.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mbeyu has operated a cafe business making staples like rice, tea, beans, chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality  as a major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, and rice for her business. She looks forward to the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, and rice for her business

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
Pramila is a married woman of 37 years old. She lives in a small village called Ambgaon located near M. Rampur block of Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. The lady standing in front raising her hand is Pramila. She lives with her family, comprising three members: her husband and one son, aged 5. She is very energetic, hardworking and enthusiastic, and always devotes her time to get her family ahead. 

Pramila has a grocery shop in which she maintains daily-needs household items. She has been selling them at retail to the customers with her husband in her locality for the last eight years to maintain her family. Initially, she started the business in a low profile with a limited investment. Gradually, she expanded her business and added some new items every year.   

In the year 2014, Pramila, along with another twelve members of her village, formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their businesses. This is the first loan of her group. 

Now she is earning 6,000 INR per month from her business, which is very scanty to manage her family. From this loan, she purchased sugar, salt, oil, rice, wheat, shampoo, tea, coffee, groundnuts, pickles, mixture, biscuits, soap, potatoes, onions, garlic, dried chilies, turmeric and other spices, and other grocery items. 

Pramila has a long-cherished desire to build a house of her own in her locality. 

The other members of her group are doing a milk business, vegetable vending, cloth store, paddy business, goat rearing, etc.

loans.use: to purchased sugar, salt, oil, rice, wheat, shampoo, tea, coffee, groundnuts, pickles, mixture, biscuits and soap.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 39-years old woman, living with her five sons, a daughter and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been doing a job in a firm on very low wages. He wants to leave this job and wants to start driving an auto rickshaw. He has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw but at the time of purchasing did not have enough money.  Therefore, Irshad has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of the savings.
  
Irshad hopes that this time her husband can easily generate sufficient income to cherish his children and can pay all the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married and has four children, two in school and the rest adults. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: 03.03.19 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Vinh works in agriculture farming, poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Vinh is 50 years old and she is married with 4 children. Vinh lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Vinh is the group leader of the 03.03.19 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

This is Vinh first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Vinh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Vinh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Vinh hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Zumrad

texts.ru: Женщина, которая является хранительницей очага своего дома и опорой для своих детей, имеет грандиозную идею, организовать новый бизнес. Она много лет не имела источника дохода. Так как ее муж имеет маленькую зарплату и не в состоянии обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Дети год за годом требуют больше благ, так как они развеваются вместе с развевающимся миром. Она решила организовать бизнес шитьём и продажей женской одежды. Она долго искала помощь и наконец, она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Ее мастерская будет расположена у неё дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки ткани. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This woman, who is heart of her household and rock for her children, has the grand idea of organizing a new business. For many years she has not had a source of income. As her husband has a small salary, he is not in the position to provide their children with all of the necessities. Year after year, their children demand more amenities, as they are developing along with a developing world. She decided to organize a sewing business and sell women's clothing. She searched for help for a long time and, finally, she heard about the course "Achieve Success" organized by the the Association of Businesswomen. She participated in this course and received many benefits for herself. After completing the course, she received a certificate. Her workshop will be located in her house. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 somoni to buy fabrics. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for organizing her new business.

loans.name: 06.01.09 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Lan is 35 years old and she is married with 1 child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Lan has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes for resale.

Lan is the group leader of the 06.01.09 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Lan has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

She has a business buying and reselling eggs in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Delia requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional trays of eggs to sell.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct-selling Avon products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Emelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of Avon to sell.

Emelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of Avon to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 43 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running the general store for 10 years. She also earns an income from fish vending.

Emma requested a 19,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid seven previous loans from NWTF. 

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 46-year-old woman living with her six children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a pot store in which he sells plastic utensils and crockery items such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glasses, jugs, mugs, cauldrons, and buckets. 

He has only one source of income and has to pay the utility bills and household expenses alone. He wants buy more inventory to sell because most of his female customers purchase utensils in large quantities for household usage. More inventory is required to cope with the sudden increase in the demand.

Tahira has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy plastic pots to sell and generate more income.

She is very thankful to Kiva field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed him a beam of hope to fulfill his desires.

loans.use: to buy plastic pots for reselling.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married mother of two children who are still underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Ruth has operated a movie and video hall business for the past four years, selling to passersby and neighbors. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more video films and chairs for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more video films and chairs for her business

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married with six school-going children. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Saumu has operated fruits and vegetable stall business for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Noy

texts.en:
Noy (in photo) is 31 years old and lives in the suburb of Phnom Penh. She has been married since 2008 and has two children, one son and one daughter. One of her children attends school and the other one is still young. 

Noy is a hairdresser, while her husband is a policeman. Noy is asking for a loan in order to purchase a motorbike for her husband. She can buy it from her neighbor but she did not pay for it yet. So, she asked for the loan to add to her own money to pay for the purchase.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Gerel

texts.en: Gerel is 22, the second child of two siblings and living with her parents in Zamboanga del Sur. She is studying med-tech in the university in Lanao del Norte. Her mother earns a salary as a teacher while her father is a machine operator in a private company. She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to pay her tuition fees for this semester. She hopes to make things possible and to make her parents proud of her.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for this semester.

loans.name: 03.03.18 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Gấm is 36 years old and she is married with two children. Gấm is the group leader of the 03.03.18 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of four members. Gấm supports her two dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has a retail business selling dried food and other general things. Gấm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and the main hardship that she faces in her business is a lack of capital.

In 2012, Gấm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Gấm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make dried food and other general things to resell. With her business profit, Gấm hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make dried food and other general thing to resell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 44 years old and married with five children. One child is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running the general store for 10 years. She also earns an income from selling gasoline.

Flordeliza requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF.
 
She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 25-year-old resident of Fort Portal town and is married with two children. Robert operates a small restaurant and shop in a very busy area which he started way back in 2010 soon after completing his studies. He says he started this business to improve his standard of living and wishes to turn it into a big hotel in the area. Bad debtors and price fluctuations are the factors hindering the operation of the business. Robert wants a loan to buy items for his hotel business.

loans.use: to buy items for his hotel business .

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 37-year-old gentleman who stays in Kigando village with four children, two of whom are of school-going age. Patrick is an agriculturalist who has owned a tea plantation since 2003. He supplements his farming with a bar business. These businesses have enabled him to support his family despite being affected by changes in weather, and theft. His dream is to expand his tea plantation which will enable him to increase his income. Thus, he is opting for a loan to plant more tea.

loans.use: to plant more tea.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: This is Josephine. Her previous loan was a big help to her business, as she was able to buy more charcoal for the business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. She would like to apply for a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
