Kwekwe is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase beans, vegetables, cooking oil, and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase beans, vegetables, cooking oil, and wheat flour for resale

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга — пенсионерка. Получаемой пенсии элементарно не хватает на жизнь, из-за чего Ольге приходится приторговывать на рынке овощами в качестве наемного работника у одного из рыночных предпринимателей. Недавно Ольга сломала ногу и ей даже делали операцию, поэтому некоторое время была нетрудоспособной. Ольга надеется, что скоро оправится полностью и сможет снова пойти подрабатывать на рынок. Ольга уже 6 лет воспитывает внучку как собственную дочь. Мать девочки, ее невестка, бросила семью и ребенка и уехала, оставив ребенка на бабушку. Ольга очень заботится о ребенке, хочет обеспечить ее жильем и вырастить пока хватает сил. 
Ольга с мужем живут в собственном доме недалеко от заповедника «Нарциссовое поле» в Хусте. Кое-что в доме уже удалось отремонтировать ранее, а именно поменяли окна и двери, провели воду в дом, достроили веранду. Теперь Ольга хочет поштукатурить дом, для чего ей нужна сумма в 10 000 гривен.
texts.en:
Olga is a retired person. Her received pension is simply not enough to live on. This is why Olga must sell vegetables at the market as a hired employee of one of the market employers. Not long ago, Olga broke her leg and had an operation which is why she was disabled for some time. Olga hopes that she will get back to normal soon and be able to once again go earn money at the market. Olga has been raising her granddaughter like her own daughter for the last six years. The girl's mother, her daughter-in-law, abandoned the family and her daughter, leaving the child with Olga. Olga really looks after the child and wants to provide her with a home and raise her while she still has the strength.

Olga and her husband live in their own home not far from the nature reserve "Narcissus Field" in Khoost. Some things in the house have already been repaired previously, specifically the windows and doors have been replaced, plumbing has been brought into the house and a porch has been constructed. Now Olga wants to re-plaster the house, for which she needs 10,000 hryvnia (UAH).

loans.use: to re-plaster her house.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, 28, is married and blessed with two children. 

For the past seven years, he has owned and operated a transportation business that provides motorcycle transportation. He earns a net income of PHP 500 daily, which he usually spends on paying for daily expenses. Due to insufficient capital, Michael is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for motorcycle maintenance and repair costs. He's hoping that his request will be granted so that he can improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. Erlinda earns more income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending business.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall for her fish vending business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jovelyn is 27 years old and has one child who is currently in school. In the picture, Jovelyn is providing a manicure/pedicure service to her customer.

Jovelyn has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nail polish, nail cutters, nippers, etc. for her business.

Jovelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nail polish, nail cutters, nippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en: Bendita is taking a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and cards. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 200 USD. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock such as noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and cards.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Evelyn has been in this business for 13 years now.

Evelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle unit for her business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle unit for her business

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 31 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Florita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Florita has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, juice, beers, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela works hard to support her family. Fidela is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 46 years now.

Fidela requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like shells, wire, etc. for her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells, wire, etc. for her business

loans.name: Abdulghafar

texts.en:
Abdulghafar, 41, is a married man who lives with his three children in Taiz, Yemen. He is an educated man who graduated from a university. Recently, he has been an employee in the public sector as a teacher. He says that his salary is not enough to cover all the living expenses of his family. 

Therefore, he decided to start up his own business. He opened a spare car parts store two years ago. His business is going very well, and he wants to expand it by purchasing more spare car parts. Unfortunately, he doesn’t have enough money to do so, and most of what he earns goes toward his family's expenses. For this reason he has requested a loan of 400,000 YER from Al-Amal-Microfinance Bank. He will use the loan to buy more spare car parts for the store.

Abdulghafar looks forward to improving his living standards. Also, he dreams of opening another branch in the future.

loans.use: to buy more spare car parts for the store.

loans.name: Guliza

texts.ru: Гулиза, 53 года, замужем, детей нет. Образование-среднее. На протяжении 35 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 6,000 сомов (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря своему упорству и трудолюбию на сегодняшний день она смогла развить животноводческую деятельность. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец и 1 бычок. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства Гулиза обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Гулиза планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота, ведь одной из ее целей является покупка легкового автомобиля.
texts.en: Guliza is 53 years old, married and does not have any children. She has a secondary education. For the last 35 years, she has been practicing livestock breeding. She started this business with 6,000 som (KGS). Her monthly income is about 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her perseverance and hard work, she has been able to develop her livestock breeding business. She currently has 2 milk cows, 10 sheep and 1 bull calf on her farm. Her husband helps her with her farm. For the purpose of the further development of her business, Guliza turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy bull calves. Guliza plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase the size of her herd. She also really wants to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy bull calves.

loans.name: Fawaz

texts.en:
Fawaz, 24, is a married man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is the father of one child, living with him in a rented house. He is an educated man who graduated from a secondary school. He couldn't complete his studies because of the hard condition of his family. Over time, Fawaz was able to accumulate a good amount of money and opened a small grocery store in his area. He started his business more than three years ago. After a short period, he sold his grocery store and opened a spice store. Now, his business is going very well, and he wants to expand it through purchasing more goods. Unfortunately, he doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has requested a loan of 200,000 YER from Al-Amal- Microfinance Bank. He will use the loan to buy more spices and goods for the store.

Fawaz looks forward to improving his living standards and he wants to open another store.

loans.use: To buy more spices and goods for his store.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman who has been blessed with 10 children, 9 in school and 1 adult. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Chizi has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting for a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 40-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children from Getafe, Bohol. She earns a living through her hog raising business. Marites has raised pigs for more than five years now. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

Marites is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and more animal feed. With this loan, Marites will be able to raise healthy pigs, which she can sell in the market for a good price. In the future, Marites hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and more animal feed.

loans.name: Guzalkhon

texts.ru: Гузалхон 30-летняя замужняя женщина, имеющая четверых детей. Ее муж занимается услугой такси, дети учатся в школе. Гузалхон тоже работает. Шесть лет назад она открыла свой торговый бизнес по купле и продаже женской одежды, детской и женской обуви. Ее торговая точка находится на центральном рынке района. Гузалхон умеет общаться с клиентами и она любит свое дело. Сейчас Гузалхон запрашивает кредит, чтобы привести сезонный товар. На сумму кредита она хотела бы приобрести коллекцию сезонной женской одежды и обуви. Данный кредит ей очень нужен для развития торговли.
texts.en: Guzalkhon is a 30-year-old married woman who has four children. Her husband is a taxi driver and her children attend school. Gulzalkhon also works. Six years ago, she opened her own retail business of buying and selling women's clothes and women's and children's shoes. Her selling stall is located in the district's central market. Gulzalkhon is able to interact with customers and she loves her job. Now Gulzalkhon is requesting a loan to buy a collection of seasonal women's clothing and shoes. This loan is very necessary for the development of her retail business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal women's clothing and shoes for the development of her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a hard-working Ugandan, age 42 and living in Kagadi. He has four children between the ages of 12 and 15 and all attend school. He has been produce selling to sustain his family and also earns from farming. He hopes to grow his business despite challenges of poor roads that make transportation of his products difficult. Julius is requesting a loan to buy beans, cassava and maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans, cassava and maize for selling.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 29-years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of one child. She is a very hard-working and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to run her household. She recently set up a small beauty parlor at home while her husband works at a small job in a firm. Both contribute their full income for household expenses. With the passage of time, her beauty products are going to be used up so she wants to buy more cosmetics for her beauty salon. 
Fozia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will buy cosmetics products such as facial cream and hair coloring, plus supplies like scissors and combs, for her salon. She hopes that through this loan she will be able to enhance her business. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy beauty products and supplies such as facial cream, hair coloring, scissors and combs for her salon.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия — частный предприниматель из Дрогобыча. Торгует на рынке. Наталия с мужем и двумя дочерьми проживает в двухкомнатной квартире. 
Давно запланированный ремонт стал уже необходимостью и Наталия решила обратиться за  дополнительной финансовой помощью, чтобы больше не откладывать дело в долгий ящик. За счет полученных средств она хочет положить новую плитку в ванной, установить гидробокс, поменять старую сантехнику на новую, поменять окно и подоконник в одной из комната и побелить ее.
texts.en:
Nataliya is a private entrepreneur from Drogobych. She sells at the market. Nataliya, her husband and her two daughters live in a two room apartment.

Their long-planned repairs have already become necessary. Nataliya decided to apply for additional financial assistance in order to not postpone the repairs indefinitely. With the received funds, she wants to put new tiles in the bathroom, install a high-quality shower, replace the old plumbing with a new system, replace the window and windowsills in one of the rooms and paint the room white.

loans.use: to remodel her bathroom and one of the rooms in her apartment.

loans.name: Falconeri

texts.en:
Falconeri is 54 years old and married with two children. Falconeri works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store and a sugarcane farming business in the Philippines. 

Falconeri has requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in the general store business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Falconeri aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a 29-year-old hard-working married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has two children who both attend school. He has been produce selling since 2010 together with farming, and running a bar operation and motorcycle business to get money for self development. He hopes to work hard and get more money in spite of constant price fluctuations. Benson is blessing and thanking lenders for the support. He is requesting a loan to buy more beans, maize and cassava to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans, maize and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Liliya

texts.ru:
Лилии — 69 лет. Она незамужем, работает на КП «Бориславводоканал» в химико-бактериологической лаборатории лаборантом химанализа. Живет она в доме на три семьи. В распоряжении Лилии находится одна комната, кухня и санузел.  
Сумма в 15 000 гривен нужна Лилии для ремонта собственного жилья, что давно было для нее насущной нуждой. Лилия хочет сделать реконструкцию коридора, отделив его от спальни стеной, а также заменить входные двери и поменять полы. Лилия очень активна, энергична несмотря на свой возраст. У нее всегда много планов, которые она готова воплощать в жизнь, как и этот ремонт.
texts.en:
Liliya is 69 years old. She is unmarried and works in the "Borislavvodokanal" Operations Center in a chemical-bacteriological laboratory as a chemical analyst lab technician. She lives in a three-family house. In Liliya's section of the house, there is one bedroom, a kitchen and a bathroom.

Liliya needs the amount of 15,000 hryvnia (UAH) to repair her own living quarters which has been her primary need for a long time already. Liliya wants to reconstruct her hallway, separating it from her bedroom wall. She also wants to replace hall doors and redo the floor. Liliya is very active and energetic despite her age. She always has a lot of plans which she is ready to put into effect, like this home repair.

loans.use: to reconstruct her corridor and change out her hallway doors and floor.

loans.name: Yussuf

texts.en:
Yussuf is a hardworking and enterprising man. He is a married man with no children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Yussuf operates a hardware business and sells workshop tools such as pliers, hack saws, nails, grease, and other items. He cites price fluctuation as a major challenge. With the loan, he wants to purchase nails, paint, timber, and workshop tools for his business. He joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase nails, paint, timber, and workshop tools for his business.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a widowed woman who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, Mose has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. Her potential customers are town-dwellers. She cites the high cost of maintenance as being her major challenge.

With the loan, Mose wants to purchase another motorcycle, to expand her business. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle, to expand her business.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Ana de 58 años de edad posee una pequeña farmacia ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja en un taller de mecánica, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina por mayor, para seguir con su negocio y asi tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 58, lives in her own house with her husband, who works as a mechanic.  She has had a small pharmacy in her home for several years.  She has a lot of customers because of the quality and good prices of her products. 

Ana's requesting a loan to buy more medicine wholesale.  She'll continue with her business and she and her husband will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medicine wholesale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 52 years old and widowed with three children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Gina has borrowed and repaid twenty loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty-five years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Gina aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia is a 64-year-old married woman living in the town of Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy nylon and fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Consorcia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy nylon and fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is a 25-year-old, married woman and a mother of a 2-year-old son from Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in sound/music services. She provides sound services for various occasions.

Richel is asking for a loan to buy more materials like plywood, wires, and speakers for making music boxes. With this, Richel will be able to improve her business and augment her income. In the future, Richel hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more materials like plywood, wires, and speakers for making music boxes.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26 year old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for two sons and one daughter. 

Mohammad has a stall for selling clothes in the city. He buys clothes from local wholesalers and resells them to the clients. It is a good business but the income is not that high. Mohammad would like to improve his business, but he does not have enough money. 

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of clothes to resell in his stall. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his sales and also his income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to resell in his stall.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a 52-year-old married man and a father of four children living in Getafe, Bohol. He has been engaged in a tricycle transport business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income.

He is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the tricycle, like wheel tires, nuts and bolts, chains and others. With this, he will be able to improve the good working condition of the tricycle, thus allowing him to transport passengers from one place to another.

In the future, Leonardo hopes to make his business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money to pay the school expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his tricycle.

loans.name: Kisuura Tweyombeke Group

texts.en:
Glades is a Ugandan 44-year-old married and hardworking lady with 6 children, 5 of whom attend school. She lives in Kagadi where she has been farming and poultry-keeping since 1998 to accumulate capital. She hopes to grow her business despite seasonal changes. 

Glades is requesting a loan to buy seeds of maize, beans, and groundnuts for planting. She is a member of Kisuura Tweyombeke Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy seeds of maize, beans, and groundnuts for planting.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija appreciates for her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is now requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has four school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Ebeneza Group

texts.en:
Anness is a mother of six children, four of whom are still at school, two already grown. Anness is in her late thirties and married. She makes her family living by running two businesses; a genge (grocery store) selling fruits and vegetable. She also sells fabrics and sarongs which she sells on credit. She has been involved in these businesses for three years. She is able to make a good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Anness' second loan, which she will use to buy stock for her businesses. She used the previous loan to replenish all of her businesses. Anness repaid, successfully, the entire loan. She earns an extra income which she uses to buy clothes for her children and to cover school bus expenses. 

Anness saved some income and invests back into her business part of her business returns. She dreams to open a big shop selling dry food items. She will share this loan with her loan group, “EBENEZA", which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her businesses.

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en:
Mark Anthony is 22 years old and single. Due to a lack of job opportunities, he decided to engage in a hog-raising business to generate income. He aims to improve the business and increase his income to support the education of his younger brother and to save some for his future. 

Due to financial insufficiency, he is asking for a loan of PHP15,000 to buy hog feeds, vitamins and piglets to raise. Through patience and hard work, he believes that he will be able to improve the business and generate sufficient income.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and piglets to raise.

location.town: Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene has been running a general store for twelve years. She is applying a new loan of PHP 22,000, her fourteenth cycle from NWTF; she successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use the loan to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. Arlene's store continues to provide her and her family  with an income that improves their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jessil

texts.en:
Jessil is 38 years old and married with three children who are all in school. Jessil works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for fifteen years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. In the future, Jessil would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 54 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mukagogo United Group

texts.en:
Robert, a 32 year old gentle man, is a resident of Harugongo, Fort Portal town. He has a business that deals in retail where he sells sugar, salt and all soft drinks. He started his business in 2002 for self sustainability. 

Robert has 2 children of school going age and is a member of Mukagogo united group, where members guarantee each other as they take small loans. He dreams of having his children attain the highest education levels. Robert is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Ngonzi Women's Group

texts.en:
Eva is an honest, married lady living in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and does farming to look after the family. She has a vision of educating her children up to the university level in spite of harsh weather conditions, especially prolonged drought, that affect her general income.

Eva intends to use the loan to buy bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and cartons of water for resale. She is a member of Ngonzi Women’s Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities. All members of the group took the photo but only nine took the loan.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and cartons of water for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
This is James. He previously accessed a loan that he used in his goat selling business. He thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support.
He is requesting for a loan to purchase more goats for resale. He appreciates Kiva for their financial support.. 

James looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in his heart.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Shani

texts.en:
Shani operates a food stall business, selling food stuffs like maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support from the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en:
Wasem is a 31-year-old single man, living with his family in Taiz, Yemen.  He is an educated man and has a diploma certificate. Due to hard conditions in the country, Wasem couldn't find a job. He was still unemployed for a long time, but he didn't give up on his goal. Fortunately, he had a good amount of money and decided to invest it in a business. 

He has opened a grocery in the house that he has been renting for more than three years. Recently, his business is going very well, and he wants to expand it through purchasing more goods and foodstuffs for the grocery. Unfortunately, most of what he earns goes to the family's expenses, and because of the debts, the capital decreases daily. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase more goods for the grocery.

Wasem looks forward to expanding his grocery and being able to get married in the future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell in his business.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Luchadoras se llama este trabajador grupo, donde todas y cada una de las mujeres han puesto su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Lilian comenta que vende remedios naturales refrescantes, también se debe destacar el trabajo que ella hace para poder ganarse la vida de una manera honrada. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que con esfuerzo y lucha está ganándose la vida.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de remedios refrescantes lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio. Ella está muy agradecida por la ayuda que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
Mujeres Luchadoras [Determined Women] is the name of this hardworking group, in which each and every one of the women has done their best to get ahead and support their families. 

Lilian says that she sells natural remedies and that she does this work to earn a living honorably. She is a selfless woman who earns a living through much effort and determination. 

Lilian is requesting this loan to buy natural remedies which will help her solidify her business plans. She is very grateful for the help she is receiving, which will allow her to continue growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do  motor repair and renew his licenses

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is 33 years old, married with two children, and lives in Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband works as a businessman and she helps him by managing her tailoring business. In order to buy additional fabrics and thread, she took out a loan from GDMPC micro-credit, which she had joined last year. She hopes to gain more income from selling made to order curtains and pillow cases in order to send her children to school and to be able to provide the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 57 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mary Jean has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a 19500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Mary Jean has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: William De Jesús

texts.es: William tiene 60 años, es soltero y con muchos ánimos de seguir laborando ya por su propia cuenta, desde hace varios años que empezó a vender mercancía a crédito en el sector donde vive y en la actualidad tiene una amplia y fiel clientela, solicita el crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (tendidos, cobijas) porque se avecinan temporadas buenas para las ventas, su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos y ganancias, y disfrutar de un buen nivel de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
William, 60, is single and motivated to continue working on his own.  Several years ago he started selling merchandise on credit in the area where he lives, and currently he has a wide and loyal clientele.

He's requesting the loan to buy merchandise wholesale (bedclothes and blankets) because a good sales season is approaching.

William's dream is to increase his income and his profits, and to enjoy a good standard of living with his family.

loans.use: to buy bedclothes and blankets wholesale

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is age 38 and lives in the Lahore area. Her husband owns a workshop in the nearby town; he provides denting and painting services for damaged bodies of vehicles. He has been doing this practice for many years and has good reputation in the market. He appointed a helper in his workshop to look after things and convince customers from outside. The number of customers has increased due to his good attitude and impressive dealing. 

To keep his reputation constant and to meet the increasing demands of the business he is in urgent need of paint and denting tools. Razia's husband is poor person and due to household expenses he does not have enough savings to buy the desired materials and denting tools for his workshop. Therefore, Razia is trying to help her husband in the form of loan. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes to the business and to the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy paint and denting tools for his vehicle services.

loans.name: Ambreen

texts.en:
Ambreen is a 23-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a plastic pot store, in which he sells utensils and crockery items such as plates, platters, dishes, cups, jars, glasses, jugs, mugs, cauldrons and buckets. 

He wants to buy more inventory to sell because most of his female customers purchase utensils in large quantity for their household and also for collecting a dowry. For this reason more inventories are required to cope with the sudden increase in the demand.

Therefore, Ambreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy plastic pots and could generate additional income in order to care for his family in a better way.

Ambreen is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed her a beam of hope for fulfilling her desires.

loans.use: to buy plastic pots for reselling.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en:
Sameh is a 22-year-old single man from a small village near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small house. 

Two years ago, Sameh opened a small grocery store in the village. He sells regular grocery products that customers often request. Sameh would like to improve his store and expand it. 

Samah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a refrigerator for keeping frozen food. By taking this loan, Sameh will be able to improve his store and sell more products in his grocery store. 

Sameh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for keeping frozen food.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat is 57 years old. She is widowed and has five children. Her children are adults. 

Sharofat has had her own business with animal husbandry for more than 26 years. Sharofat feeds cows. Now she has two cows. She sells milk and milk products. 

Sharofat earns additional income from growing tomatoes and cucumbers. Now, she is going to repair her house, as her house is in bad condition. 

Sharofat is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy cement, wood, paints, etc. for repairing the house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cement, wood, paints, etc. for repairing his house

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Josie is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva loans. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 45-year old lady living along with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

The financial condition of her family is not good. Her husband has grown old; even in his old age, he is doing a scrap business. He is a hawker and purchases scrap iron, plastic, waste paper, etc. from door to door. He uses his four-wheeled cart to carry the goods from one place to another. 

He wants to buy scrap goods in large quantity on a daily basis, but he does not have enough cash in hand. This is the reason Nazeeran has requested a loan for her husband, so he would be able to buy a large quantity of scrap goods on a daily basis.

Nazeeran hopes that through the profit amount, she will make more savings to meet the sudden incidents.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of scrap goods for resale.

loans.name: Sanoatoy

texts.en:
Sanoatoy was born in 1969. She is hardworking and a smart woman. She is married and has four children. Sanoatoy has been busy growing rice, cotton, cucumbers, etc. for more than 9 years. She has 2.80 hectares of her own land and 7.32 hectares of rental land. She likes her job and covers her daily costs from the profit from her farm. 

Sanoatoy needs to sow crops for the new season, but she has not enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: San Gregorio Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Gregorio está en el 1er ciclo del programa del comité de mujeres, es un grupo muy emprendedor y que fueron creciendo de apoco, ya que todas están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo.
Una de ellas es Daisy, quien trabaja y lucha por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y trabaja en la venta de remedios naturales, y por medio de su digno trabajo está ganándose la vida de una forma honrada y digna. Ella es una persona muy luchadora que con sacrificio está luchando.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales para la venta, y de esa forma seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en:
The "San Gregorio" group is on its first loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme. The members are very enterprising and have grown little by little as each of them has put in the maximum effort to their work.

One member of the group is Daisy - she works and fights in order to improve her living conditions. She makes a living selling natural remedies and, through her work, she is making an honest and decent living. Daisy is very plucky and is making sacrifices to improve her life.

Daisy is applying for this loan in order to buy natural remedies to sell. Through this work she will continue to fight for a better life. Daisy is grateful for the opportunity that all the group's members are receiving to help them to grow.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sale.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia tiene 35 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta el nivel bachillerato, tiene un hijo pequeño dependiente de sus ingresos y  vive en la casa que sus padres le dejaron como herencia. Se dedica a la elaboración de quesillos los cuales son vendidos en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Cochabamba, trabaja muy duro para poder sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo, quien está en etapa escolar y es un alumno destacado del colegio, el niño le ayuda con la alimentación del ganado, cuenta con 5 cabezas de ganado lechero, el padre de su hijo la abandono cuando se enteró de su embarazo, desde ese momento la señora supo salir adelante por su propio sacrificio. El motivo del presente crédito es para poder comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado lechero pues con las constantes lluvias este alimento está escaseando y es cada vez más difícil de conseguir dicho alimento, de esta forma continuara con su actividad y lograra obtener ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia is 35 years old and completed high school. She has a young son who depends on her income. She lives in the house that she inherited from her parents. Sonia makes a living selling cheeses in the centre of Cochabamba city. Sonia works very hard to in order to help her son to prosper - he is at school and receives very good grades; he also helps to feed the cattle. Sonia has five dairy cows. The father of Sonia's son left her when he learned that she was pregnant. Since then Sonia has learned to get ahead through her own sacrifice.

Sonia is applying for this loan in order to be able to buy feed for her dairy cattle. With constant rain, there is little food around and it is becoming more and more difficult to find feed. With this loan Sonia will continue with her work and will manage to earn an income to cover family costs.

loans.use: to buy feed for her dairy cattle.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en: Lucrecia is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is engaged in retail sales of dry goods like clothing and other items. Lucrecia is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like shirts, pants, undergarments, slippers and shoes. With this, she will be able to improve her inventory thus allowing her to sell more products to her customers. In the future, Lucrecia has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like shirts, pants, undergarments, slippers and shoes

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 39 and a mother of two. Due to financial insufficiency, she is engaged in a vegetable vending business to help her husband in generating income. She aims to improve the business and increase her income to support the education of her children. 

Having not enough capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy additional stock of tomatoes, bitter melon, eggplants, squash, beans, onions, cabbages and sweet potatoes to sell. She is hoping that her loan will help her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of tomatoes, bitter melon, eggplants, squash, beans, onions, cabbages and sweet potatoes to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Palabotan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Melencia

texts.en: Melencia, 58 years of age, is married to a vegetable vendor and blessed with four children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost twenty years and earns a net income of PHP 1,500 daily. Her profits are usually spent on their daily expenditures. Due to inadequate funds she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, detergent, soap, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her retail store will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, detergent, soap, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Estrellita Azul Group

texts.es:
Estrellita azul es un grupo, formado en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, que actualmente este en su ciclo número 3 del programa de eliminación de la pobreza. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que están luchando por poder mejorar.
Una de ellas es Elena, quien es una mujer muy trabajadora, y muy buena en lo que hace, ya que hace todo tipo de comidas, y por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia, dándoles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Ella ve una oportunidad de crecer por medio del programa de comité de mujeres. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar fideos, carne, leche, panificados, arroz, bebidas, aceite, harina, etc., y de esa forma poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
"Estrellita Azul" is a loan group from San Lorenzo - the group is currently on its third loan cycle as part of the poverty elimination survey. The members are women and heads of their families, and are fighting for better lives.

One member of the group is Elena, a woman who is very hard-working and very good at what she does. Elena makes meals and, through her work, she helps her family and gives them everything that she could not have. Elena has identified an opportunity to grow through the women's committee programme.

Elena is applying for this loan in order to buy pastas, meat, milk, breads, rice, drinks, oil, flour and more to continue making the meals that she sells. Elena is thankful for this opportunity to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy pastas, meat, milk, breads, rice, drinks, oil, flour and more to make meals to sell.

loans.name: Badr

texts.en:
Badr is a 52-year-old married mother of three children, who has owned a convenience store in her village since June 2011, while her husband works in a restaurant. Their combined revenue is barely enough to provide for the entire family.

Thus, she contacted Al Majmoua because it was her last hope to acquire a loan. In fact, she needs it to pay for her son's school educational fees, and to purchase wooden doors for her house. 

Badr is working hard on developing her business, in a well-managed way through diversifying the business merchandise and to make sure that it will cover her family's increasing needs.

loans.use: To pay for her son's school educational fees, and to purchase wooden doors for her house
